data:
1
00:00:16,083 --> 00:00:18,385
First, there was darkness.

2
00:00:19,920 --> 00:00:22,823
Then came the Strangers.

3
00:00:22,856 --> 00:00:25,592
They were a race
as old as time itself.

4
00:00:26,693 --> 00:00:29,329
They had mastered
the ultimate technology--

5
00:00:29,396 --> 00:00:34,668
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

6
00:00:34,701 --> 00:00:37,304
They called this ability
''Tuning.''

7
00:00:38,505 --> 00:00:40,374
But they were dying.

8
00:00:40,407 --> 00:00:43,410
Their civilization was
in decline,

9
00:00:43,477 --> 00:00:46,180
and so they abandoned
their world,

10
00:00:46,246 --> 00:00:48,882
seeking a cure
for their own mortality.

11
00:00:50,284 --> 00:00:53,754
Their endless journey brought
them to a small, blue world...

12
00:00:53,820 --> 00:00:55,923
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy.

13
00:00:56,957 --> 00:00:58,425
Our world.

14
00:00:59,459 --> 00:01:01,461
Here, they thought
they had finally found...

15
00:01:01,528 --> 00:01:03,463
what they had been
searching for.

16
00:01:14,274 --> 00:01:17,177
My name is
Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber.

17
00:01:18,145 --> 00:01:19,780
l am just a man.

18
00:01:19,847 --> 00:01:22,683
l help the Strangers
conduct their experiments.

19
00:01:24,218 --> 00:01:26,253
l have betrayed my own kind.

20
00:04:53,727 --> 00:04:55,529
You are confused, aren't you?

21
00:04:55,562 --> 00:04:58,365
Frightened. That's all right.
l can help you.

22
00:04:58,398 --> 00:04:59,967
-Who is this?
-l'm a doctor.

23
00:05:00,033 --> 00:05:02,769
You must listen to me.
You have lost your memory.

24
00:05:02,803 --> 00:05:04,905
There was an experiment.
Something went wrong.

25
00:05:04,972 --> 00:05:07,107
Your memory was erased.
Do you understand me?

26
00:05:07,174 --> 00:05:09,209
No, l don't understand.
What's going on here?

27
00:05:09,276 --> 00:05:12,079
There are people coming for you
as we speak.

28
00:05:12,112 --> 00:05:14,414
Don't let them find you.
Leave now.

29
00:05:15,582 --> 00:05:17,751
Hello? Are you there?

30
00:05:59,927 --> 00:06:02,396
Hey, Mr. Murdoch,
the Automat called.

31
00:06:02,429 --> 00:06:03,931
Said you left your wallet there.

32
00:06:04,998 --> 00:06:08,602
l suggest you retrieve it, since
you only paid for three weeks,

33
00:06:08,669 --> 00:06:10,437
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

34
00:06:12,506 --> 00:06:13,974
l've been here three weeks?

35
00:06:14,007 --> 00:06:17,144
lt's right there
in black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

36
00:06:17,211 --> 00:06:19,613
Day and date.

37
00:06:19,646 --> 00:06:22,983
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

38
00:06:23,016 --> 00:06:25,986
-l'll take care of it later.
-See that you do.

39
00:06:26,053 --> 00:06:28,155
Only thing makes you a guest
in this joint...

40
00:06:28,222 --> 00:06:29,590
is cash on the barrelhead!

41
00:06:47,474 --> 00:06:50,177
House rules.
Three weeks is three weeks.

42
00:06:50,244 --> 00:06:52,746
No days off for good behavior.

43
00:07:03,690 --> 00:07:07,327
Mr. Murdoch, yes?
Where is he?

44
00:07:07,394 --> 00:07:10,831
He just left
not five minutes ago.

45
00:07:12,232 --> 00:07:13,934
Sleep now.

46
00:07:16,570 --> 00:07:20,574
When the rumba rhythm
start to play

47
00:07:20,641 --> 00:07:22,776
Dance with me

48
00:07:22,843 --> 00:07:25,879
Make me sway

49
00:07:25,946 --> 00:07:29,883
Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore

50
00:07:29,950 --> 00:07:32,186
Hold me close

51
00:07:32,219 --> 00:07:35,055
Sway me more

52
00:07:35,088 --> 00:07:39,359
Like a flower bending
in the breeze

53
00:07:39,393 --> 00:07:41,829
Bend with me

54
00:07:41,862 --> 00:07:44,698
Sway with ease

55
00:07:44,731 --> 00:07:48,669
When we dance,
you have a way with me

56
00:07:48,735 --> 00:07:51,205
Stay with me

57
00:07:51,238 --> 00:07:53,774
Sway with me

58
00:07:54,575 --> 00:07:58,612
Hey, sweetie, he said he was
your husband's doctor.

59
00:07:58,679 --> 00:08:00,214
He wanted to speak with you.

60
00:08:20,434 --> 00:08:21,668
Excuse me.

61
00:08:23,670 --> 00:08:25,205
-Doctor...
-Schreber.

62
00:08:25,272 --> 00:08:29,276
Please, won't you come in?
You must be Emma Murdoch.

63
00:08:30,644 --> 00:08:34,047
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

64
00:08:34,081 --> 00:08:35,549
What is this?

65
00:08:35,582 --> 00:08:39,152
A rather crude experiment
designed to further my studies.

66
00:08:39,219 --> 00:08:42,856
l don't understand. You say
you're my husband's doctor,

67
00:08:42,923 --> 00:08:45,459
but he never
mentioned you to me.

68
00:08:45,526 --> 00:08:48,328
The truth is, John has been
coming to see me...

69
00:08:48,362 --> 00:08:49,796
for quite some time.

70
00:08:49,830 --> 00:08:53,200
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

71
00:08:53,233 --> 00:08:56,270
stemming from
your marital difficulties.

72
00:08:56,336 --> 00:08:58,238
-John told you what happened.
-Yes.

73
00:08:59,640 --> 00:09:01,909
When was the last time
that you saw him?

74
00:09:01,942 --> 00:09:04,845
Three weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

75
00:09:04,878 --> 00:09:07,347
He was very angry at me.

76
00:09:07,414 --> 00:09:10,250
l understand how difficult
this must be for you,

77
00:09:10,284 --> 00:09:11,652
but for John's sake,

78
00:09:11,685 --> 00:09:14,621
l would like you to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

79
00:09:14,655 --> 00:09:18,292
lt appears that John
has suffered a psychotic break.

80
00:09:18,358 --> 00:09:21,461
-Complete memory loss.
-You can't be serious.

81
00:09:21,528 --> 00:09:24,498
Oh, but l am.
He may be delusional.

82
00:09:24,531 --> 00:09:25,766
Even violent.

83
00:09:27,167 --> 00:09:31,104
lf he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

84
00:09:31,138 --> 00:09:33,607
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

85
00:09:35,375 --> 00:09:36,543
For himself.

86
00:09:46,753 --> 00:09:50,624
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
lt is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

87
00:09:51,592 --> 00:09:55,028
Mr. ''J'' something Murdoch?

88
00:09:58,398 --> 00:10:02,569
J. Murdoch. What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

89
00:10:06,874 --> 00:10:08,942
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

90
00:10:09,009 --> 00:10:11,578
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

91
00:10:17,951 --> 00:10:19,686
Got to get a grip on myself.

92
00:10:43,810 --> 00:10:47,181
l told the guy,
cash on the barrelhead.

93
00:10:47,214 --> 00:10:50,517
l said, ''Listen,
three weeks is three weeks.''

94
00:10:50,551 --> 00:10:54,121
-Where's our lucky winner?
-Upstairs, sir. Room 614.

95
00:10:55,389 --> 00:10:56,723
The call girl.

96
00:11:01,361 --> 00:11:04,264
-Evening, Husselbeck.
-lnspector Bumstead.

97
00:11:04,298 --> 00:11:05,999
Your lace is untied.

98
00:11:07,301 --> 00:11:08,502
Sorry.

99
00:11:16,977 --> 00:11:18,512
Am l glad you're here, sir.

100
00:11:18,579 --> 00:11:21,181
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

101
00:11:21,248 --> 00:11:23,417
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

102
00:11:54,348 --> 00:11:56,850
-Thanks a lot.
-Excuse me.

103
00:11:59,319 --> 00:12:01,054
-Hello?
-Oh, it's you.

104
00:12:01,822 --> 00:12:04,491
-You left your wallet here.
-When did l do that?

105
00:12:04,558 --> 00:12:06,727
-When you was last here.
-When was that?

106
00:12:06,793 --> 00:12:10,197
When you left your wallet.
Expect me to remember?

107
00:12:16,003 --> 00:12:18,772
-Excuse me!
-No, no, seriously.

108
00:12:36,156 --> 00:12:37,991
-Where you headed, chief?
-Home.

109
00:12:38,025 --> 00:12:39,359
And where's home?

110
00:12:39,393 --> 00:12:42,162
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

111
00:12:42,196 --> 00:12:44,464
l'm just doing my job, May.

112
00:12:44,498 --> 00:12:46,533
There's a killer out there.

113
00:12:46,600 --> 00:12:49,236
Look for him
instead of cooling your heels.

114
00:12:52,573 --> 00:12:54,274
Go on. Get out of here.

115
00:13:03,250 --> 00:13:04,284
Come on.

116
00:13:07,554 --> 00:13:10,357
What's that make so far?
Six hookers in all?

117
00:13:10,390 --> 00:13:13,293
-l believe so, sir.
-Give the man an ''A'' for effort.

118
00:13:18,699 --> 00:13:21,001
So, Husselbeck,

119
00:13:21,034 --> 00:13:27,474
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

120
00:13:27,541 --> 00:13:29,443
-Got me, sir.
-Bumstead.

121
00:13:29,476 --> 00:13:32,746
What took you? This killer's
been running circles around us,

122
00:13:32,779 --> 00:13:33,881
thanks to Walenski.

123
00:13:33,947 --> 00:13:35,749
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector,

124
00:13:35,782 --> 00:13:38,819
l've known Eddie a long time,
and he's a good cop.

125
00:13:38,886 --> 00:13:41,088
Whatever kind of cop
Walenski once was...

126
00:13:41,155 --> 00:13:43,090
he let drift a long time ago.

127
00:13:43,123 --> 00:13:44,892
Let me talk to Bumstead!

128
00:13:44,925 --> 00:13:46,960
Come on! Hold on!

129
00:13:47,661 --> 00:13:48,795
Frank!

130
00:13:51,899 --> 00:13:53,934
-Get his arm !
-They're watching us!

131
00:13:54,001 --> 00:13:56,270
-On your feet!
-There's no way out!

132
00:13:57,671 --> 00:13:59,339
God, can't you see?

133
00:14:02,776 --> 00:14:05,145
Let me go!
l'm not going to hurt you.

134
00:14:06,680 --> 00:14:08,849
-What was that?
-Walenski.

135
00:14:17,291 --> 00:14:20,394
l'm being punished
for my sins, right?

136
00:14:20,460 --> 00:14:24,765
What did l ever do to inherit
this? Where do you begin?

137
00:14:24,798 --> 00:14:27,734
Well, everything Detective
Walenski committed to paper...

138
00:14:27,768 --> 00:14:29,203
should be here, so--

139
00:14:29,236 --> 00:14:31,839
The only thing that should be
committed is Walenski.

140
00:14:34,174 --> 00:14:36,043
Nothing like
a little healthy paranoia.

141
00:14:42,583 --> 00:14:45,919
l came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

142
00:14:45,953 --> 00:14:49,389
-Take it to the front desk.
-They told me to come see you.

143
00:14:51,658 --> 00:14:53,293
His name's John Murdoch.

144
00:14:56,396 --> 00:14:59,733
Do these names mean
anything to you?

145
00:15:00,567 --> 00:15:02,536
Who are these women?

146
00:15:02,569 --> 00:15:04,438
Why are you looking
for my husband?

147
00:15:04,471 --> 00:15:06,740
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

148
00:15:06,773 --> 00:15:10,310
-Maybe. Maybe murder.
-Whose murder?

149
00:15:11,745 --> 00:15:14,982
-Which one?
-All of them.

150
00:15:16,416 --> 00:15:19,720
Mrs. Murdoch, l am sorry.
l didn't mean to alarm you.

151
00:15:19,753 --> 00:15:22,456
l'm sorry that l came.
l just made a mistake.

152
00:15:22,523 --> 00:15:26,293
lf you'd please just give me
half a second to explain.

153
00:15:35,669 --> 00:15:36,904
We met before?

154
00:15:38,605 --> 00:15:41,608
lf we did,
l hope you're still breathing.

155
00:15:41,675 --> 00:15:43,243
What's your name, honey?

156
00:15:47,047 --> 00:15:48,816
Well, that's
an appropriate name.

157
00:15:56,757 --> 00:15:58,058
l was just thinking.

158
00:16:02,262 --> 00:16:03,797
What you do...

159
00:16:05,032 --> 00:16:10,070
lt seems kind of dangerous...
right now.

160
00:16:10,137 --> 00:16:12,072
How do you know
l'm not the killer?

161
00:16:12,105 --> 00:16:15,375
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

162
00:16:16,310 --> 00:16:18,479
You feeling any urges
l should know about?

163
00:16:30,624 --> 00:16:31,758
Shoot.

164
00:17:19,439 --> 00:17:23,310
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

165
00:17:23,343 --> 00:17:27,147
-Who are you?
-We might ask the same question.

166
00:17:28,148 --> 00:17:30,350
Sleep...now.

167
00:17:55,909 --> 00:17:57,077
He can Tune!

168
00:18:50,297 --> 00:18:53,433
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

169
00:18:53,500 --> 00:18:56,603
-lt is said he is able to Tune.
-lmpossible!

170
00:18:56,670 --> 00:18:59,706
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

171
00:18:59,773 --> 00:19:02,609
On occasion, the imprinting
does not take.

172
00:19:02,643 --> 00:19:05,145
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

173
00:19:05,212 --> 00:19:08,849
We find them wandering
like lost children.

174
00:19:08,916 --> 00:19:11,051
But this one was different, yes?

175
00:19:11,118 --> 00:19:14,822
-What has the doctor to say?
-He has failed to report in.

176
00:19:14,888 --> 00:19:17,991
-And Mr. Quick?
-No more Mr. Quick.

177
00:19:18,058 --> 00:19:20,661
Mr. Quick...dead, yes.

178
00:19:24,064 --> 00:19:26,667
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

179
00:19:26,733 --> 00:19:29,670
Mr. Book...does he know?

180
00:19:30,671 --> 00:19:32,706
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

181
00:19:33,740 --> 00:19:36,643
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

182
00:19:36,677 --> 00:19:39,613
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

183
00:19:39,646 --> 00:19:41,915
We must have this man.

184
00:19:47,855 --> 00:19:48,989
My brand, l hope.

185
00:20:01,335 --> 00:20:02,903
l've been worried about you.

186
00:20:06,940 --> 00:20:08,275
Are you punishing me?

187
00:20:09,042 --> 00:20:11,645
lf disappearing is
your way of punishing me,

188
00:20:11,712 --> 00:20:12,880
l don't appreciate it.

189
00:20:12,946 --> 00:20:14,081
What are you talking about?

190
00:20:17,618 --> 00:20:21,421
l found these keys in my pocket,
so l assume l live here.

191
00:20:23,590 --> 00:20:25,926
-You supposed to be my wife?
-''Supposed to be''?

192
00:20:29,463 --> 00:20:33,467
You really...don't know
who l am, do you.

193
00:20:34,334 --> 00:20:37,137
Your doctor called me. He was
worried that this might happen.

194
00:20:37,171 --> 00:20:38,472
My doctor?

195
00:20:41,408 --> 00:20:45,078
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

196
00:20:52,853 --> 00:20:54,855
Feel like l'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

197
00:20:54,922 --> 00:20:57,724
What happened to me?
Why was l seeing a doctor?

198
00:20:58,292 --> 00:20:59,793
l had an affair.

199
00:21:01,695 --> 00:21:03,063
You were angry at me.

200
00:21:06,233 --> 00:21:09,870
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

201
00:21:19,613 --> 00:21:21,949
Most unfortunate it is...

202
00:21:21,982 --> 00:21:24,284
that we were forced
to seek you out here.

203
00:21:25,252 --> 00:21:29,389
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

204
00:21:30,290 --> 00:21:33,594
-l'm sorry. l--
-Failed to report in, yes?

205
00:21:33,627 --> 00:21:36,563
l was frightened.
l have a weak heart, you know.

206
00:21:36,597 --> 00:21:40,100
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

207
00:21:40,167 --> 00:21:42,803
We found this in his hotel room.

208
00:21:42,870 --> 00:21:46,373
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

209
00:21:46,440 --> 00:21:48,542
l tried to reprint him,
but he woke up.

210
00:21:48,609 --> 00:21:50,777
He knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

211
00:21:50,844 --> 00:21:54,014
-He has no memories, then?
-Only fragments.

212
00:21:54,081 --> 00:21:55,582
The procedure,
it was interrupted.

213
00:21:55,649 --> 00:21:58,318
l guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

214
00:21:59,086 --> 00:22:00,787
You have had strays
before, right?

215
00:22:00,854 --> 00:22:04,725
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can Tune.

216
00:22:04,758 --> 00:22:07,794
But that's impossible.
Only you have that ability.

217
00:22:07,861 --> 00:22:10,164
You will process
another template...

218
00:22:10,197 --> 00:22:12,232
of the subject's memories, yes?

219
00:22:12,299 --> 00:22:13,834
Of course.
l'll imprint him again.

220
00:22:15,469 --> 00:22:18,672
We require them
for a quite different purpose.

221
00:22:18,739 --> 00:22:21,542
lt's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

222
00:22:21,575 --> 00:22:23,410
We'll talk again
after tonight's Tuning,

223
00:22:23,443 --> 00:22:26,380
but no more delays, yes?

224
00:22:26,413 --> 00:22:31,218
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

225
00:22:33,086 --> 00:22:34,721
The police were looking for you.

226
00:22:34,788 --> 00:22:36,924
l know. l saw the papers.

227
00:22:36,990 --> 00:22:39,459
''Killer stalks
city street-walkers.''

228
00:22:43,096 --> 00:22:45,399
l was with one of those women.

229
00:22:46,934 --> 00:22:50,370
-Before l came here tonight.
-l don't understand.

230
00:22:50,404 --> 00:22:55,342
l met her outside an Automat.
l guess l wanted to test myself.

231
00:22:57,044 --> 00:23:00,447
l wanted to know if l had it
in me to do those things.

232
00:23:00,481 --> 00:23:01,949
Maybe l have lost my mind,

233
00:23:02,015 --> 00:23:04,985
but whoever l am, l'm still me,
and l'm not a killer.

234
00:23:11,024 --> 00:23:12,326
l believe you.

235
00:23:14,228 --> 00:23:15,395
You do?

236
00:23:20,000 --> 00:23:21,969
-What?
-The car outside.

237
00:23:22,035 --> 00:23:23,470
The one you arrived in.

238
00:23:23,504 --> 00:23:25,806
lt's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

239
00:23:27,975 --> 00:23:29,710
l didn't know he was still here.

240
00:23:33,313 --> 00:23:34,781
Hold it right there, mister!

241
00:23:37,184 --> 00:23:40,187
-Wait. You have the wrong man.
-Stand aside, will you, please?

242
00:23:40,254 --> 00:23:41,722
l didn't kill anyone.

243
00:23:41,755 --> 00:23:44,057
Right now,
all you are is a suspect.

244
00:23:44,091 --> 00:23:47,261
Turn yourself in. l'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

245
00:23:47,327 --> 00:23:49,396
You won't believe
what l have to say.

246
00:23:50,564 --> 00:23:53,800
-Try me.
-There's someone after me.

247
00:23:53,867 --> 00:23:57,471
lt's this group of men.
They want me dead.

248
00:23:57,538 --> 00:24:00,407
And l don't even know if...
they're not even--

249
00:24:00,440 --> 00:24:02,643
Yeah, who's going to listen
to a madman?

250
00:24:02,709 --> 00:24:05,179
-Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.
-Run!

251
00:24:09,516 --> 00:24:11,485
No one ever listens to me.

252
00:24:17,791 --> 00:24:18,826
Murdoch, stop!

253
00:25:01,735 --> 00:25:04,037
-How much further?
-We're almost there, buddy.

254
00:25:07,608 --> 00:25:09,977
You happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

255
00:25:10,010 --> 00:25:13,046
You're kidding! Me and the wife
spent our honeymoon there.

256
00:25:13,113 --> 00:25:15,616
All you do is
take Main Street West to...

257
00:25:18,619 --> 00:25:21,822
Or is it the Cross...
Now, that's funny.

258
00:25:21,889 --> 00:25:24,992
l can't seem to remember
if it's Main Street West...

259
00:25:25,058 --> 00:25:26,360
or the Crosstown.

260
00:25:31,031 --> 00:25:34,067
l'm sorry, lnspector,
l cannot be of more assistance,

261
00:25:34,134 --> 00:25:36,103
but l am running late
for an appointment.

262
00:25:36,136 --> 00:25:38,272
Well, l appreciate you
taking the time.

263
00:25:47,014 --> 00:25:49,416
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

264
00:25:49,449 --> 00:25:53,987
l've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

265
00:25:54,054 --> 00:25:56,723
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

266
00:25:56,790 --> 00:25:59,960
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

267
00:26:00,027 --> 00:26:02,896
Well, l do know when
someone is lying to me, Doctor.

268
00:26:02,930 --> 00:26:07,100
lnspector, judging personalities
happens to be my business.

269
00:26:07,167 --> 00:26:09,136
Maybe you can give me
a few pointers.

270
00:26:09,203 --> 00:26:13,140
Certainly.
Let's take you, for instance.

271
00:26:13,173 --> 00:26:16,276
You are a fastidious man.
Driven.

272
00:26:16,343 --> 00:26:18,645
Consumed by details.

273
00:26:18,679 --> 00:26:22,149
l would say
your life is rather lonely.

274
00:26:22,216 --> 00:26:24,751
Good evening, lnspector.
l really must be going.

275
00:27:02,556 --> 00:27:03,624
Come in.

276
00:27:08,662 --> 00:27:10,430
-How is he?
-The same.

277
00:27:11,732 --> 00:27:14,368
Walenski? lt's me, Frank.

278
00:27:20,774 --> 00:27:21,942
Come in, Frank.

279
00:27:25,212 --> 00:27:26,413
Close the door.

280
00:27:34,488 --> 00:27:37,791
l've been looking through
some of your old reports.

281
00:27:37,825 --> 00:27:39,893
lt's an interesting case.

282
00:27:41,028 --> 00:27:44,198
Kind that make a man's career.

283
00:27:45,933 --> 00:27:49,570
-Or break it.
-Yeah. l was on that case.

284
00:27:49,636 --> 00:27:53,474
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

285
00:27:53,507 --> 00:27:54,942
Nothing happened, Frank.

286
00:27:55,943 --> 00:27:57,945
l've just been spending time
in the subway,

287
00:27:58,011 --> 00:27:59,913
riding in circles.

288
00:27:59,947 --> 00:28:03,484
Thinking in circles.
There's no way out.

289
00:28:05,752 --> 00:28:07,421
l've been over this entire city.

290
00:28:11,925 --> 00:28:13,827
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

291
00:28:13,861 --> 00:28:15,329
She's not my wife.

292
00:28:17,197 --> 00:28:20,167
l don't know who she is
or who any of us are.

293
00:28:20,200 --> 00:28:23,570
-What makes you say that?
-You think about the past much?

294
00:28:25,639 --> 00:28:27,107
As much as the next guy.

295
00:28:28,142 --> 00:28:30,844
See, l've been trying
to remember things--

296
00:28:30,911 --> 00:28:33,981
clearly remember things
from my past.

297
00:28:34,047 --> 00:28:36,183
But the more
l try to think back,

298
00:28:36,250 --> 00:28:39,219
the more it all starts
to unravel.

299
00:28:39,286 --> 00:28:40,420
None of it seems real.

300
00:28:40,487 --> 00:28:44,625
lt's like l've just
been dreaming this life,

301
00:28:44,691 --> 00:28:47,661
and when l finally wake up,
l'll be somebody else,

302
00:28:47,694 --> 00:28:49,663
somebody totally different.

303
00:28:54,067 --> 00:28:56,203
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie.

304
00:28:57,371 --> 00:28:59,873
Something to do with the case.

305
00:29:00,474 --> 00:29:03,877
There is no case!
There never was!

306
00:29:03,911 --> 00:29:07,815
lt's all just a big joke!
lt's a joke!

307
00:29:48,889 --> 00:29:50,591
Tonight's requirements are...

308
00:29:50,657 --> 00:29:53,894
12 family photo albums,

309
00:29:53,961 --> 00:29:56,363
nine personal diaries,

310
00:29:56,396 --> 00:29:58,532
17 love letters,

311
00:29:58,599 --> 00:30:01,001
assorted childhood photographs,

312
00:30:01,034 --> 00:30:05,205
requisite false l.D.s
and social security cards.

313
00:30:05,272 --> 00:30:07,508
These do bring back memories.

314
00:30:09,910 --> 00:30:12,146
This one is still warm.

315
00:30:12,980 --> 00:30:14,081
What is it?

316
00:30:14,148 --> 00:30:17,317
The recollections of
a great lover?

317
00:30:17,384 --> 00:30:19,686
A catalogue of conquests?

318
00:30:20,420 --> 00:30:21,889
We will soon find out.

319
00:30:23,190 --> 00:30:24,658
You wouldn't
appreciate that,

320
00:30:24,725 --> 00:30:27,928
would you,
Mr. Whatever-your-name is?

321
00:30:27,995 --> 00:30:32,299
Not the sort of conquest
you would ever understand.

322
00:30:33,100 --> 00:30:34,334
Let's see.

323
00:30:35,669 --> 00:30:38,338
A touch of
unhappy childhood...

324
00:30:44,044 --> 00:30:46,613
A dash of
teenage rebellion...

325
00:30:48,215 --> 00:30:51,285
And last but not least...

326
00:30:51,351 --> 00:30:53,921
a tragic death
in the family.

327
00:30:56,790 --> 00:30:58,425
Mr. Book.

328
00:31:05,432 --> 00:31:09,002
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the Tuning?

329
00:31:09,069 --> 00:31:13,307
Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

330
00:31:13,373 --> 00:31:14,541
A freak of nature.

331
00:31:14,608 --> 00:31:17,478
He's adapting to survive.
What do you expect?

332
00:31:17,511 --> 00:31:19,413
Weren't you looking for
the human soul?

333
00:31:19,446 --> 00:31:22,049
lsn't that the purpose
of your little zoo?

334
00:31:22,115 --> 00:31:25,452
That's why you change people
and things every night.

335
00:31:25,486 --> 00:31:28,388
Maybe you have finally
found what you are looking for,

336
00:31:28,422 --> 00:31:29,957
and it's going to bite you
on your--

337
00:31:33,994 --> 00:31:35,929
lt requires several
of your lifetimes...

338
00:31:35,963 --> 00:31:37,598
to master our gifts.

339
00:31:37,664 --> 00:31:39,500
The idea that
a simple man...

340
00:31:39,533 --> 00:31:41,502
could develop the ability
to Tune is--

341
00:31:41,568 --> 00:31:42,669
Absurd, l know.

342
00:31:42,736 --> 00:31:45,038
What other explanation is there?

343
00:31:50,010 --> 00:31:51,145
lt is time.

344
00:32:37,090 --> 00:32:38,525
Shut it down.

345
00:32:57,077 --> 00:33:00,147
Fredrickson says he'll take me
off the night shift.

346
00:33:00,214 --> 00:33:02,082
lt's about time, dear.

347
00:33:52,833 --> 00:33:53,801
Hello?

348
00:34:02,109 --> 00:34:03,477
Wake up.

349
00:34:06,580 --> 00:34:08,048
Wake up!

350
00:34:18,158 --> 00:34:20,294
Can anyone hear me?

351
00:34:23,464 --> 00:34:26,300
Let the Tuning commence.

352
00:37:06,160 --> 00:37:07,528
The Goodwins.

353
00:37:07,561 --> 00:37:09,530
Charlie, Sylvia,

354
00:37:09,596 --> 00:37:11,665
Jane, and little Matthew.

355
00:37:15,569 --> 00:37:17,738
Jane and little Matthew.

356
00:37:47,935 --> 00:37:50,137
The rich get richer.

357
00:37:50,204 --> 00:37:52,306
Probably have
maid's quarters...

358
00:37:52,372 --> 00:37:53,740
before the night
is through.

359
00:38:47,294 --> 00:38:49,263
Dr. Schreber, l presume.

360
00:38:49,296 --> 00:38:50,764
lt's you.

361
00:38:50,831 --> 00:38:51,865
Hey, come on.

362
00:38:51,932 --> 00:38:54,001
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor,

363
00:38:54,067 --> 00:38:56,203
if that's what you are.

364
00:38:56,270 --> 00:38:57,704
Please, l--

365
00:38:57,738 --> 00:38:59,540
Why is everyone asleep?

366
00:38:59,606 --> 00:39:02,009
Please keep your voice down.

367
00:39:02,042 --> 00:39:03,977
l can't remember anything.
What have you done?

368
00:39:04,011 --> 00:39:06,780
Nothing. l want to help you.

369
00:39:06,847 --> 00:39:10,250
We cannot talk here.
lf they see us together--

370
00:39:10,284 --> 00:39:13,187
l don't care.
l want some answers. Now!

371
00:39:13,220 --> 00:39:16,323
Who are they?
Why are they trying to kill me?

372
00:39:16,390 --> 00:39:17,491
Answer me!

373
00:39:22,629 --> 00:39:23,630
My God.

374
00:39:23,697 --> 00:39:26,733
-You really can do it.
-l did that?

375
00:39:26,800 --> 00:39:29,369
Listen to me.
You have their power.

376
00:39:29,436 --> 00:39:31,405
You can make things happen
by will alone.

377
00:39:31,438 --> 00:39:33,006
They call it ''Tuning.''

378
00:39:33,073 --> 00:39:35,042
That is how they change
the buildings.

379
00:39:35,075 --> 00:39:37,578
Just now you acted
out of self-defense,

380
00:39:37,644 --> 00:39:40,380
but l can teach you
to control your power.

381
00:39:40,447 --> 00:39:44,418
We can stop them.
We can take the city back.

382
00:39:47,754 --> 00:39:49,223
My glasses.

383
00:40:43,477 --> 00:40:45,813
He made a terrible impression
for the firm,

384
00:40:45,846 --> 00:40:48,682
lollygagging around
as he did.

385
00:40:48,715 --> 00:40:51,618
So l told Fredrickson
l was letting him go.

386
00:40:51,652 --> 00:40:53,620
Well you should have, darling.

387
00:40:54,388 --> 00:40:57,424
He attacked me.
l don't know where he's gone.

388
00:40:57,958 --> 00:41:01,895
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do.

389
00:41:01,962 --> 00:41:04,531
-Yes?
-Yes.

390
00:41:06,967 --> 00:41:13,373
They say that
you're a runaround lover

391
00:41:14,475 --> 00:41:22,483
Though you say it isn't so

392
00:41:25,419 --> 00:41:32,259
But if you put me down
for another

393
00:41:33,861 --> 00:41:39,733
l'll know, believe me, l'll know

394
00:41:41,201 --> 00:41:44,705
Tonight's experiment will
take place in these locations.

395
00:41:44,771 --> 00:41:48,775
The first subject
shall be imprinted on Avenue M.

396
00:41:48,842 --> 00:41:51,812
Mr. Book, there is a problem.

397
00:41:51,879 --> 00:41:53,447
There is no Avenue M.

398
00:41:53,514 --> 00:41:55,382
We were unable
to complete it.

399
00:41:55,415 --> 00:41:58,886
During the last Tuning,
we detected a lack of control.

400
00:41:58,952 --> 00:42:02,156
An opposing influence
on the machines?

401
00:42:02,222 --> 00:42:06,426
This man Murdoch is
more powerful than we thought.

402
00:42:06,493 --> 00:42:08,428
He is becoming like us.

403
00:42:08,462 --> 00:42:11,899
So we must become like him.

404
00:42:12,833 --> 00:42:15,169
The doctor has done as we asked?

405
00:42:15,202 --> 00:42:18,872
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume two.

406
00:42:20,908 --> 00:42:23,477
We must not do this.

407
00:42:23,544 --> 00:42:26,914
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

408
00:42:26,947 --> 00:42:29,783
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

409
00:42:29,817 --> 00:42:33,253
Everywhere he goes,
everyone he seeks out...

410
00:42:33,287 --> 00:42:34,521
will be known to us.

411
00:42:34,588 --> 00:42:39,693
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

412
00:42:39,760 --> 00:42:42,196
But to imprint one of us?

413
00:42:42,229 --> 00:42:44,898
Failure has always resulted.

414
00:42:44,965 --> 00:42:48,502
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

415
00:42:48,569 --> 00:42:50,170
lmprint.

416
00:42:55,609 --> 00:42:57,544
This may sting a bit.

417
00:43:34,047 --> 00:43:35,716
ls it done?

418
00:43:35,783 --> 00:43:38,218
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

419
00:43:38,252 --> 00:43:42,089
l have John Murdoch in mind.

420
00:43:42,723 --> 00:43:44,324
''Johnny...

421
00:43:44,391 --> 00:43:48,362
''Found this postcard
among your mother's things.

422
00:43:48,428 --> 00:43:50,631
''Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

423
00:43:50,697 --> 00:43:52,533
''Stop by sometime.

424
00:43:52,599 --> 00:43:55,836
''We'll see if we can't
hook ourselves another mermaid.

425
00:43:55,903 --> 00:43:58,238
''Love to Emma. Karl.''

426
00:44:03,710 --> 00:44:04,678
Karl.

427
00:44:06,580 --> 00:44:08,215
Karl Harris.

428
00:44:16,390 --> 00:44:17,424
Harris.

429
00:44:25,732 --> 00:44:28,769
Excuse me.
Which way is Avenue C?

430
00:44:28,836 --> 00:44:30,037
Try the subway.

431
00:44:33,807 --> 00:44:35,275
You got a problem, pal?

432
00:44:35,342 --> 00:44:38,178
Been working here long?

433
00:44:38,212 --> 00:44:41,548
25 years.
No days off for good behavior.

434
00:45:06,707 --> 00:45:09,643
We're looking for John Murdoch.

435
00:45:43,844 --> 00:45:45,913
She knows nothing,
Mr. Hand.

436
00:45:45,979 --> 00:45:47,815
A dead end, Mr. Wall.

437
00:45:47,881 --> 00:45:50,584
We thought his imprint
would let us track him.

438
00:45:50,651 --> 00:45:53,153
But instead
we have been brought here.

439
00:45:53,220 --> 00:45:57,224
-This is irrational.
-lnstincts are irrational.

440
00:45:57,291 --> 00:46:00,561
We must follow
where they lead, yes?

441
00:46:00,627 --> 00:46:03,864
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar.

442
00:46:03,931 --> 00:46:05,265
His job.

443
00:46:05,299 --> 00:46:07,301
He does not care about our job.

444
00:46:07,367 --> 00:46:10,204
lndulge us, Mr. Hand.

445
00:46:10,237 --> 00:46:12,873
lf you were Murdoch, yes?

446
00:46:12,940 --> 00:46:16,276
lf l were Murdoch...

447
00:46:18,078 --> 00:46:21,548
l would remember how
my wife had hurt me...

448
00:46:21,615 --> 00:46:23,617
by sleeping with another man.

449
00:46:25,219 --> 00:46:26,687
And then...

450
00:46:28,622 --> 00:46:32,025
l would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

451
00:46:35,062 --> 00:46:39,600
Leave me alone with her.
There's work to be done.

452
00:46:43,303 --> 00:46:45,372
All change,
platform three.

453
00:46:48,075 --> 00:46:49,176
All change?

454
00:46:49,243 --> 00:46:51,512
Excuse me, how do l get
to the end of the line?

455
00:46:51,578 --> 00:46:53,046
You want the Express.

456
00:47:05,659 --> 00:47:08,128
How come the train didn't stop?

457
00:47:08,162 --> 00:47:09,429
That's the Express.

458
00:47:10,998 --> 00:47:12,900
There's no way out.

459
00:47:12,933 --> 00:47:15,769
You can't get out of the city.
l've tried.

460
00:47:16,870 --> 00:47:18,939
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

461
00:47:19,006 --> 00:47:20,641
The one
they've been looking for.

462
00:47:20,707 --> 00:47:21,809
You're not a killer.

463
00:47:21,875 --> 00:47:24,578
They set you up with
a fake identity,

464
00:47:24,645 --> 00:47:26,246
like everyone else here.

465
00:47:26,313 --> 00:47:28,215
-Who are you?
-l was a cop.

466
00:47:28,248 --> 00:47:31,351
At least in this life l was.

467
00:47:31,418 --> 00:47:34,288
They steal peoples' memories.

468
00:47:34,321 --> 00:47:36,089
Then they swap them around
between us.

469
00:47:36,156 --> 00:47:38,826
l seen them do it,
back and forth...

470
00:47:38,892 --> 00:47:40,994
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

471
00:47:41,061 --> 00:47:42,329
How do you know all this?

472
00:47:42,396 --> 00:47:44,164
Once in a while one of us
wakes up...

473
00:47:44,231 --> 00:47:45,666
while they're changing things.

474
00:47:46,567 --> 00:47:49,036
lt's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

475
00:47:49,103 --> 00:47:50,404
lt happened to me.

476
00:47:51,138 --> 00:47:53,040
They'll come looking for you.

477
00:47:54,174 --> 00:47:56,477
Just like they'll come
looking for me.

478
00:47:56,543 --> 00:47:57,945
But that's OK.

479
00:47:57,978 --> 00:47:59,179
l figured a way out.

480
00:48:10,624 --> 00:48:11,859
They were here.

481
00:48:13,961 --> 00:48:15,395
Last night.

482
00:48:15,429 --> 00:48:17,631
This was to be his home.

483
00:48:20,300 --> 00:48:22,102
That was when we loved her.

484
00:48:22,169 --> 00:48:24,438
This is all well and good,

485
00:48:24,505 --> 00:48:26,507
but we require
a more practical link...

486
00:48:26,573 --> 00:48:28,609
to his present whereabouts.

487
00:48:33,247 --> 00:48:35,249
And l know where to find her.

488
00:48:43,724 --> 00:48:46,994
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

489
00:48:47,060 --> 00:48:48,061
l'm sorry?

490
00:48:48,128 --> 00:48:50,164
To be able to revisit
those places...

491
00:48:50,230 --> 00:48:52,199
which meant
so very much to us.

492
00:48:53,066 --> 00:48:55,569
l thought we were haunted
by them.

493
00:48:55,636 --> 00:48:57,337
Perhaps.

494
00:48:57,404 --> 00:48:59,873
There used to be a ferry
when l was a boy.

495
00:48:59,907 --> 00:49:01,942
Biggest thing you ever saw.

496
00:49:02,009 --> 00:49:04,812
Lit up like
a floating birthday cake.

497
00:49:06,246 --> 00:49:08,782
That's just what my husband
once said to me.

498
00:49:08,849 --> 00:49:10,384
On this very spot.

499
00:49:11,885 --> 00:49:13,954
Where is your husband now?

500
00:49:14,021 --> 00:49:17,825
l wish l knew.
What brings you here?

501
00:49:17,891 --> 00:49:20,761
l met my wife at this place.

502
00:49:20,794 --> 00:49:23,030
lt's where l met my husband.

503
00:49:23,096 --> 00:49:24,565
Small world.

504
00:50:18,719 --> 00:50:19,686
Hello?

505
00:51:07,067 --> 00:51:08,936
What are you doing here?

506
00:51:08,969 --> 00:51:10,571
l've been following you.

507
00:51:14,541 --> 00:51:16,210
Hold it right there!

508
00:51:18,312 --> 00:51:19,279
Johnny?

509
00:51:22,416 --> 00:51:23,684
lt's been so damn long,

510
00:51:23,750 --> 00:51:25,853
l thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

511
00:51:27,087 --> 00:51:28,522
You son of a gun!

512
00:51:31,925 --> 00:51:33,093
Uncle Karl...

513
00:51:36,230 --> 00:51:37,197
Wait.

514
00:51:40,100 --> 00:51:42,202
-ls that me?
-Yeah.

515
00:51:50,511 --> 00:51:52,246
Shell Beach is where
l grew up?

516
00:51:52,312 --> 00:51:54,915
That's what l said.
Shell Beach.

517
00:51:54,982 --> 00:51:57,417
-Your home town.
-l need to get there.

518
00:51:57,451 --> 00:51:58,485
How do l get there?

519
00:51:59,920 --> 00:52:02,823
l don't know.
l haven't been there in years.

520
00:52:02,856 --> 00:52:05,726
You must remember.
You must have some idea.

521
00:52:07,694 --> 00:52:08,929
Sorry, Johnny.

522
00:52:10,364 --> 00:52:12,900
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

523
00:52:16,737 --> 00:52:20,174
-lt was so bright there.
-Brighter times, l guess.

524
00:52:21,942 --> 00:52:25,212
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

525
00:52:25,279 --> 00:52:27,247
That's me and your Pa.

526
00:52:27,281 --> 00:52:29,583
What a couple of
handsome fools.

527
00:52:29,650 --> 00:52:31,151
What happened to my parents?

528
00:52:33,720 --> 00:52:34,855
Where are they now?

529
00:52:36,123 --> 00:52:37,891
They're dead, Johnny.

530
00:52:37,958 --> 00:52:40,694
They died when the house
burned down.

531
00:52:40,761 --> 00:52:42,329
l looked after you.

532
00:52:43,263 --> 00:52:45,032
You don't remember that,
really?

533
00:52:47,868 --> 00:52:50,370
What's that? What is that?

534
00:52:56,210 --> 00:52:58,045
lt's a scar.

535
00:52:58,112 --> 00:53:00,414
You burned your arm pretty bad
in the fire.

536
00:53:06,019 --> 00:53:07,554
What does it mean?

537
00:53:07,621 --> 00:53:09,590
lt means these are all lies!

538
00:53:13,694 --> 00:53:15,996
My husband told me
he'd been here.

539
00:53:16,063 --> 00:53:18,832
He told me he wanted
to test himself.

540
00:53:18,899 --> 00:53:21,168
See if he was...

541
00:53:21,235 --> 00:53:23,537
capable of...

542
00:53:32,446 --> 00:53:34,248
l wanted to talk to her.

543
00:53:34,314 --> 00:53:36,283
l thought she could
help me find him.

544
00:53:38,018 --> 00:53:39,987
l'm going to call the station.

545
00:53:56,170 --> 00:53:57,371
lt's beautiful.

546
00:54:00,073 --> 00:54:02,910
lt was a gift from my mother.

547
00:54:02,943 --> 00:54:04,478
She died recently.

548
00:54:05,879 --> 00:54:08,148
l keep it with me
to remind me of her.

549
00:54:10,284 --> 00:54:11,318
l'm sorry.

550
00:54:15,022 --> 00:54:17,124
lt's a funny thing, though.

551
00:54:17,191 --> 00:54:19,626
l can't remember
when she gave it to me.

552
00:54:22,096 --> 00:54:24,531
How do you think l could
forget a thing like that?

553
00:54:25,999 --> 00:54:28,469
What's happening, lnspector?

554
00:54:28,502 --> 00:54:30,304
l'm not sure l know anymore.

555
00:54:34,308 --> 00:54:36,043
l left your old room
like it was.

556
00:54:37,111 --> 00:54:39,346
You can sleep here tonight.

557
00:54:39,413 --> 00:54:41,482
Glad to have you back, Johnny.

558
00:54:41,548 --> 00:54:44,284
-Even if it is for just a night.
-Karl.

559
00:54:45,452 --> 00:54:48,088
-ls that the right time?
-Why, sure.

560
00:54:48,155 --> 00:54:50,591
That clock's kept perfect time
since l bought it.

561
00:54:50,624 --> 00:54:51,925
A.M. or P.M.?

562
00:54:53,627 --> 00:54:56,029
-What do you think?
-l don't understand.

563
00:54:56,063 --> 00:54:58,799
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

564
00:54:58,866 --> 00:55:01,368
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

565
00:55:03,070 --> 00:55:04,037
Get some sleep.

566
00:55:04,071 --> 00:55:06,540
We'll straighten all this out
tomorrow.

567
00:55:38,672 --> 00:55:39,907
Come on...

568
00:56:00,327 --> 00:56:03,297
He's here.
He's acting peculiar.

569
00:56:03,363 --> 00:56:05,732
l know. He's not himself.

570
00:56:05,766 --> 00:56:07,801
Keep him there,
and l'll be right over.

571
00:56:07,868 --> 00:56:10,070
-l'll try.
-Thanks. Bye.

572
00:56:13,674 --> 00:56:17,010
l can't promise anything.
We'll play it as it comes.

573
00:56:17,778 --> 00:56:20,581
We just wanted to help.

574
00:56:27,354 --> 00:56:30,958
Karl. Uncle Karl.

575
00:56:31,024 --> 00:56:34,461
lf you're in trouble,
maybe we can do something.

576
00:56:35,929 --> 00:56:38,432
Haven't seen you in so long.

577
00:57:53,006 --> 00:57:57,644
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

578
00:58:02,516 --> 00:58:04,918
-Start talking.
-There's no need for this.

579
00:58:04,952 --> 00:58:08,489
There's no escape.
The city's ours. We made it.

580
00:58:08,555 --> 00:58:09,890
What are you talking about?

581
00:58:09,957 --> 00:58:13,026
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories.

582
00:58:13,093 --> 00:58:16,797
Different eras, different pasts,
all rolled into one.

583
00:58:16,864 --> 00:58:20,901
Each night we revise it,
refine it, in order to learn.

584
00:58:20,968 --> 00:58:23,971
-Learn what?
-About you.

585
00:58:24,037 --> 00:58:28,442
You and your fellow inhabitants.
What makes you human.

586
00:58:28,475 --> 00:58:31,945
-Why?
-We need to be like you.

587
00:58:32,746 --> 00:58:34,882
l understand you now.

588
00:58:34,948 --> 00:58:38,519
l remember that which you do
not, what you've been missing.

589
00:58:38,585 --> 00:58:44,091
The ocean, yes? Running along
the waves as a child.

590
00:58:44,158 --> 00:58:48,662
Meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

591
00:58:49,663 --> 00:58:52,766
-What are you?
-You've seen what we are.

592
00:58:52,833 --> 00:58:55,402
We use your dead as vessels.

593
01:01:05,099 --> 01:01:06,066
Get in!

594
01:01:21,548 --> 01:01:25,486
-What about her? Ring a bell?
-She was alive when l left her.

595
01:01:25,519 --> 01:01:28,555
-What about this?
-This is nothing.

596
01:01:28,622 --> 01:01:30,791
lt must mean something--
all those pictures.

597
01:01:30,858 --> 01:01:31,825
What pictures?

598
01:01:33,327 --> 01:01:36,196
-l don't understand this.
-Stop playing games with me.

599
01:01:36,230 --> 01:01:38,699
-Stop telling me lies.
-l am not telling lies!

600
01:01:38,732 --> 01:01:41,034
Help me out.
Make me understand.

601
01:01:41,101 --> 01:01:46,039
l have this jigsaw puzzle in
my face, and it makes no sense.

602
01:01:46,106 --> 01:01:49,443
You think it makes sense to me?
l'm as confused as you are.

603
01:01:49,510 --> 01:01:53,413
Let me ask you a question.
Have you heard of Shell Beach?

604
01:01:53,447 --> 01:01:55,582
-Sure.
-You know how to get there?

605
01:01:55,649 --> 01:01:57,284
-Yeah.
-Tell me.

606
01:01:57,885 --> 01:02:03,090
-Right. You just go to the...
-Where? Where do you go?

607
01:02:03,157 --> 01:02:04,792
Give me a second, will you?

608
01:02:06,760 --> 01:02:08,328
You can't remember, can you?

609
01:02:09,763 --> 01:02:12,232
Thinking that's kind of odd?

610
01:02:13,467 --> 01:02:15,536
Wait. l got a better one.

611
01:02:15,602 --> 01:02:19,339
When was the last time you
did something during the day?

612
01:02:19,973 --> 01:02:22,943
-What do you mean?
-l just mean during the day.

613
01:02:24,178 --> 01:02:26,880
Daylight. When was the last
time you remember seeing it?

614
01:02:26,947 --> 01:02:30,617
l'm not talking about a distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

615
01:02:30,684 --> 01:02:33,420
l mean, like, yesterday.
Last week? When?

616
01:02:34,421 --> 01:02:36,156
Do you have a single memory?

617
01:02:37,958 --> 01:02:39,660
You don't, do you?

618
01:02:39,726 --> 01:02:45,232
l don't think the sun
even exists in this place.

619
01:02:45,299 --> 01:02:49,436
'Cause l've been up for hours
and hours, and night never ends.

620
01:02:50,070 --> 01:02:52,339
-That's crazy.
-You're damn right it's crazy.

621
01:02:52,406 --> 01:02:55,943
But listen to me, Bumstead.
lt's not just me.

622
01:02:56,009 --> 01:02:58,946
lt's all of us. They're doing
something to all of us.

623
01:02:58,979 --> 01:03:00,814
Shut up.
l've heard enough.

624
01:03:00,881 --> 01:03:03,584
-Please listen--
-Shut up!

625
01:03:14,061 --> 01:03:16,797
There has to be an explanation.

626
01:03:24,204 --> 01:03:25,172
Explain this.

627
01:03:47,027 --> 01:03:48,495
l'm so sorry.

628
01:03:49,630 --> 01:03:52,566
l never meant to hurt you.
l don't know why l did.

629
01:03:52,599 --> 01:03:54,334
l wish l could take it back.

630
01:03:55,068 --> 01:03:57,337
You didn't do it.

631
01:03:57,404 --> 01:03:59,106
This affair of yours,

632
01:03:59,173 --> 01:04:02,176
whatever you think you've done,
you didn't do it.

633
01:04:02,242 --> 01:04:03,444
l don't believe it happened.

634
01:04:03,510 --> 01:04:07,281
-What do you mean?
-This will sound crazy.

635
01:04:07,347 --> 01:04:10,451
What if we never knew
each other before now?

636
01:04:10,517 --> 01:04:16,723
What if the first time we met
was last night in our apartment?

637
01:04:16,790 --> 01:04:19,493
And everything you remember,

638
01:04:19,560 --> 01:04:22,729
and everything l'm supposed to
remember never really happened.

639
01:04:22,796 --> 01:04:25,265
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

640
01:04:26,233 --> 01:04:27,734
But how can that be true?

641
01:04:28,368 --> 01:04:31,338
l so vividly remember
meeting you.

642
01:04:32,673 --> 01:04:35,008
l remember falling in love
with you.

643
01:04:36,643 --> 01:04:39,580
-l remember losing you.
-Time's up.

644
01:04:41,181 --> 01:04:45,919
No, wait, please.
Just one more minute.

645
01:04:52,459 --> 01:04:53,961
l love you, John.

646
01:04:57,397 --> 01:04:59,533
You can't fake something
like that.

647
01:05:01,235 --> 01:05:02,703
No, you can't.

648
01:05:31,999 --> 01:05:34,535
lnspector? Sir?

649
01:05:35,969 --> 01:05:38,639
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

650
01:05:41,041 --> 01:05:42,443
l thought you should know.

651
01:05:45,079 --> 01:05:49,383
The chief wanted to see you.
Sir?

652
01:05:56,323 --> 01:05:58,225
l knew you'd track
the killer down.

653
01:06:13,707 --> 01:06:14,808
Shoelace.

654
01:06:28,021 --> 01:06:31,158
-How can we help you, sir?
-You can sleep.

655
01:06:34,628 --> 01:06:36,296
Sleep. Sleep.

656
01:06:40,100 --> 01:06:41,201
Evening.

657
01:06:54,148 --> 01:06:57,718
l wanted to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

658
01:07:00,320 --> 01:07:03,123
Take us to Murdoch.

659
01:07:03,190 --> 01:07:04,158
Sleep.

660
01:07:34,688 --> 01:07:36,256
l knew you'd come eventually.

661
01:07:36,323 --> 01:07:38,792
lsn't it time
you gave me some answers?

662
01:07:40,127 --> 01:07:42,863
Yes, of course.
Won't you please sit down?

663
01:07:46,133 --> 01:07:48,001
l come here often.

664
01:07:48,068 --> 01:07:50,604
lt's one of the few places
l'm allowed some peace.

665
01:07:51,071 --> 01:07:54,108
You see, they have
an aversion to water.

666
01:07:55,109 --> 01:07:57,077
One could almost call it
a phobia.

667
01:07:57,578 --> 01:08:00,180
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

668
01:08:00,247 --> 01:08:01,215
Right.

669
01:08:01,949 --> 01:08:06,653
For now, let's say you're
the subject of their experiment.

670
01:08:06,720 --> 01:08:08,155
We all are.

671
01:08:09,823 --> 01:08:15,629
l'm sorry, but l have no time
to do this the right way.

672
01:08:15,696 --> 01:08:19,700
Everything you need to know
is in this syringe.

673
01:08:19,767 --> 01:08:23,303
l need you to inject yourself.
lt's the only way to understand.

674
01:08:23,370 --> 01:08:26,140
-You're kidding, right?
-We're running out of time!

675
01:08:26,206 --> 01:08:29,843
-You have to do this now.
-Give me the gun.

676
01:08:29,910 --> 01:08:32,045
He's more disturbed
than we thought.

677
01:08:32,112 --> 01:08:34,948
l may not be the judge
of personality you are,

678
01:08:35,015 --> 01:08:37,985
but you're the one
who looks disturbed.

679
01:08:38,018 --> 01:08:40,521
You don't know what
you're doing.

680
01:08:41,755 --> 01:08:45,659
What exactly is in this, Doctor?

681
01:08:47,361 --> 01:08:50,497
All the answers you've been
looking for, l swear to you.

682
01:08:52,466 --> 01:08:58,172
Guess l'll hold on to it for
safekeeping, if you don't mind.

683
01:08:58,238 --> 01:08:59,573
Let's go, Doctor.

684
01:09:01,141 --> 01:09:04,278
Go? Where are we going?

685
01:09:04,711 --> 01:09:06,447
Shell Beach.

686
01:09:07,548 --> 01:09:11,018
That's where you wanted to go,
isn't it, the ocean?

687
01:09:19,860 --> 01:09:23,297
Won't find anything there.
l've been there--

688
01:09:23,330 --> 01:09:25,632
Then you can show us the way.

689
01:09:25,699 --> 01:09:29,336
l won't. l refuse.
You can't make me go there.

690
01:09:29,403 --> 01:09:31,839
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

691
01:09:41,148 --> 01:09:45,586
l don't understand.
There used to be a bridge here.

692
01:09:50,991 --> 01:09:54,027
Try that again, and your friends
will find you in the canal.

693
01:09:54,094 --> 01:09:55,863
Don't hurt me.
l'll tell you everything.

694
01:09:55,929 --> 01:09:57,664
lt doesn't matter anymore
anyway.

695
01:10:04,571 --> 01:10:05,539
What?

696
01:10:08,942 --> 01:10:10,477
Who are you people?

697
01:10:10,911 --> 01:10:13,680
Must go to the end
of the canal.

698
01:10:15,015 --> 01:10:17,618
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

699
01:10:18,786 --> 01:10:21,088
-Anna.
-l'm not Anna.

700
01:10:22,790 --> 01:10:24,825
You will be soon, yes.

701
01:10:29,096 --> 01:10:31,932
l have another use
for her first.

702
01:10:41,442 --> 01:10:43,343
l call them Strangers.

703
01:10:43,911 --> 01:10:46,346
They abducted us
and brought us here.

704
01:10:47,548 --> 01:10:51,985
This city, everyone in it...
is their experiment.

705
01:10:52,019 --> 01:10:54,688
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit,

706
01:10:54,755 --> 01:10:57,391
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

707
01:10:57,925 --> 01:11:00,727
One day, a man might be
an inspector.

708
01:11:00,794 --> 01:11:03,564
The next,
someone entirely different.

709
01:11:03,964 --> 01:11:07,401
When they want to study
a murderer, for instance,

710
01:11:07,434 --> 01:11:11,872
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality.

711
01:11:11,939 --> 01:11:16,176
Arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

712
01:11:16,243 --> 01:11:18,078
even a lost wallet.

713
01:11:18,145 --> 01:11:20,247
Then they observe the results.

714
01:11:21,548 --> 01:11:25,686
Will a man, given the history of
a killer, continue in that vein?

715
01:11:26,186 --> 01:11:29,757
Or are we, in fact, more than
the sum of our memories?

716
01:11:29,823 --> 01:11:34,361
This business of you being
a killer was a sad coincidence.

717
01:11:35,028 --> 01:11:37,598
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

718
01:11:37,664 --> 01:11:39,099
You happened to wake up...

719
01:11:39,133 --> 01:11:41,935
while l was imprinting you
with this one.

720
01:11:42,002 --> 01:11:43,971
Why are they doing all this?

721
01:11:44,037 --> 01:11:48,142
lt is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

722
01:11:48,208 --> 01:11:50,010
that makes us different
from them.

723
01:11:50,077 --> 01:11:52,546
They think they'll find
the human soul...

724
01:11:52,579 --> 01:11:55,249
if they understand
how our memories work.

725
01:11:55,315 --> 01:11:59,753
They have collective memories.
They share one group mind.

726
01:11:59,820 --> 01:12:04,658
They're dying. Their race is
on the brink of extinction.

727
01:12:04,725 --> 01:12:07,728
-They think we can save them.
-Where do l fit in?

728
01:12:07,795 --> 01:12:12,299
You're different. You resisted
my attempt to imprint you.

729
01:12:17,237 --> 01:12:20,674
Somehow, you have developed
their ability to Tune.

730
01:12:20,741 --> 01:12:23,977
That is how they change things,
how they built this city.

731
01:12:24,044 --> 01:12:26,914
They have machines buried
beneath the surface...

732
01:12:26,980 --> 01:12:30,484
that allow them to focus
their telepathic energies.

733
01:12:31,251 --> 01:12:33,854
They control everything here,
even the sun.

734
01:12:33,921 --> 01:12:37,091
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

735
01:12:37,157 --> 01:12:38,559
Why do they need you?

736
01:12:38,625 --> 01:12:40,594
When they first brought us here,

737
01:12:40,627 --> 01:12:44,898
they extracted what was in us
and stored the information,

738
01:12:44,965 --> 01:12:46,900
remixed it like paint...

739
01:12:46,934 --> 01:12:49,436
and gave us back
new memories of their choosing.

740
01:12:49,503 --> 01:12:53,107
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

741
01:12:54,875 --> 01:12:59,813
l understood the human mind
better than they ever could,

742
01:12:59,880 --> 01:13:03,450
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist...

743
01:13:03,517 --> 01:13:04,918
because they needed them.

744
01:13:04,985 --> 01:13:07,387
They made me delete
everything else.

745
01:13:15,996 --> 01:13:20,467
Can you imagine what it's like
to erase your own past?

746
01:13:20,534 --> 01:13:23,737
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

747
01:13:24,671 --> 01:13:26,707
Shell Beach. Uncle Karl.

748
01:13:27,941 --> 01:13:32,012
What about this?
This was blank when l found it.

749
01:13:32,079 --> 01:13:35,916
You still don't understand.
You were never a boy.

750
01:13:35,983 --> 01:13:37,251
Not in this place.

751
01:13:37,317 --> 01:13:40,220
Your history is an illusion,
a fabrication,

752
01:13:40,254 --> 01:13:42,055
as it is with all of us.

753
01:13:42,122 --> 01:13:44,625
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

754
01:13:44,691 --> 01:13:46,160
You say they brought us here.

755
01:13:48,562 --> 01:13:49,530
From where?

756
01:13:53,434 --> 01:13:56,570
l'm sorry. l don't remember.

757
01:13:57,438 --> 01:14:01,608
None of us remember that...
what we once were...

758
01:14:01,675 --> 01:14:05,212
what we might have been...
somewhere else.

759
01:14:23,030 --> 01:14:26,767
l've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

760
01:14:26,834 --> 01:14:27,801
Let's go.

761
01:15:13,213 --> 01:15:15,449
There is no ocean, John.

762
01:15:16,750 --> 01:15:18,886
There's nothing beyond the city.

763
01:15:20,521 --> 01:15:22,990
The only place home exists...

764
01:15:25,225 --> 01:15:26,794
is in your head.

765
01:15:38,238 --> 01:15:39,206
Stop!

766
01:15:52,352 --> 01:15:53,320
Please!

767
01:16:14,208 --> 01:16:16,310
Now you know the truth.

768
01:17:15,869 --> 01:17:18,539
You'll allow yourself
to surrender...

769
01:17:18,605 --> 01:17:20,874
or it will result in
this one's death.

770
01:17:20,941 --> 01:17:22,109
What do l care?

771
01:17:22,576 --> 01:17:24,645
She's not my real wife.
She's nothing to me.

772
01:17:24,711 --> 01:17:29,349
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

773
01:17:29,416 --> 01:17:33,654
l have become the monster
you were intended to be.

774
01:17:35,656 --> 01:17:39,159
Shall l end her life now,
as you would have?

775
01:17:42,730 --> 01:17:48,001
-Don't hurt her, please.
-Then surrender.

776
01:17:50,237 --> 01:17:51,205
Sleep.

777
01:17:53,373 --> 01:17:54,341
Now.

778
01:18:13,660 --> 01:18:14,628
Sleep.

779
01:18:23,704 --> 01:18:25,072
Kill him.

780
01:18:25,139 --> 01:18:26,106
Kill him !

781
01:18:36,683 --> 01:18:40,120
He is powerful, yes, dangerous.

782
01:18:40,187 --> 01:18:43,490
But he can also lead us
to what we seek...

783
01:18:43,557 --> 01:18:46,693
what the doctor calls the soul.

784
01:18:46,760 --> 01:18:50,697
lt is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

785
01:18:50,764 --> 01:18:53,534
We no longer need
the other subjects.

786
01:18:53,600 --> 01:18:56,937
The time for study is over.

787
01:18:57,004 --> 01:19:01,308
lt is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

788
01:19:08,148 --> 01:19:11,485
lt is time, Doctor. lmprint.

789
01:19:14,154 --> 01:19:16,323
Shut it down!

790
01:19:17,257 --> 01:19:19,626
Shut it down forever.

791
01:19:34,308 --> 01:19:35,375
What are you doing?

792
01:19:36,310 --> 01:19:40,981
They want to imprint you with
their own collective memories.

793
01:19:42,116 --> 01:19:44,284
They want to make you
one of them...

794
01:19:44,351 --> 01:19:46,520
so they can share your soul.

795
01:19:46,587 --> 01:19:48,889
But l've got other plans.

796
01:19:52,292 --> 01:19:55,129
lmprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

797
01:19:55,195 --> 01:19:59,833
l'm sorry. The pain will
only last a moment.

798
01:20:10,978 --> 01:20:12,646
Remember, John.

799
01:20:13,680 --> 01:20:15,716
You'll rise to greater heights
than that.

800
01:20:15,783 --> 01:20:18,218
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

801
01:20:19,553 --> 01:20:20,521
Remember.

802
01:20:21,922 --> 01:20:24,725
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

803
01:20:24,792 --> 01:20:27,995
Now, remember what l told you.
Never talk to strangers.

804
01:20:28,395 --> 01:20:29,730
John, remember.

805
01:20:29,963 --> 01:20:32,699
You're probably wondering why l
keep appearing in your memories.

806
01:20:32,766 --> 01:20:35,169
lt's because l have
inserted myself in them.

807
01:20:35,235 --> 01:20:39,206
They were fabricated to
teach you about the Strangers.

808
01:20:39,273 --> 01:20:42,342
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

809
01:20:45,212 --> 01:20:49,850
You will survive, John. You'll
find strength within yourself.

810
01:20:49,917 --> 01:20:51,452
And you will prevail.

811
01:20:52,152 --> 01:20:53,253
Remember.

812
01:20:53,987 --> 01:20:56,190
-Hi, Uncle Karl.
-Johnny!

813
01:20:59,159 --> 01:21:03,263
Getting the hang of it, John.
Maybe one day l'll work for you.

814
01:21:03,897 --> 01:21:07,501
Here's the machine the Strangers
use to amplify their thoughts,

815
01:21:07,568 --> 01:21:09,303
the machine that changes
their world.

816
01:21:09,369 --> 01:21:12,606
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

817
01:21:12,673 --> 01:21:17,244
l know you can beat them,
but you must concentrate.

818
01:21:19,279 --> 01:21:20,481
Something's wrong.

819
01:21:29,289 --> 01:21:31,158
There is no time for romance.

820
01:21:31,225 --> 01:21:33,293
The world can be
what you make it.

821
01:21:34,328 --> 01:21:35,362
What have you done?

822
01:21:36,463 --> 01:21:38,599
You have the power
to make anything happen...

823
01:21:38,665 --> 01:21:40,567
but you must act now.

824
01:26:24,885 --> 01:26:29,156
l knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

825
01:26:29,223 --> 01:26:31,492
-You control their machines.
-Where's Emma?

826
01:26:32,659 --> 01:26:37,097
She's not Emma anymore.
She has been reimprinted.

827
01:26:37,131 --> 01:26:39,366
-So give her back her memories.
-l can't.

828
01:26:39,433 --> 01:26:43,504
The facility where they stored
the memories has been destroyed.

829
01:26:44,338 --> 01:26:45,305
l'm sorry.

830
01:26:46,740 --> 01:26:48,709
What are you going to do now?

831
01:26:51,712 --> 01:26:53,180
l'm gonna fix things.

832
01:26:54,848 --> 01:26:58,118
You told me l had the power,
didn't you?

833
01:26:59,086 --> 01:27:02,056
l can make these machines
do anything l want.

834
01:27:03,090 --> 01:27:05,125
Make this world
anything l want it to be.

835
01:27:06,393 --> 01:27:10,431
Just so long as l concentrate
hard enough.

836
01:28:34,114 --> 01:28:35,315
Where are you going?

837
01:28:38,819 --> 01:28:39,787
Shell Beach.

838
01:29:21,195 --> 01:29:22,663
-What's the fare?
-A quarter.

839
01:29:29,470 --> 01:29:31,171
-Please.
-Oh, no, sit.

840
01:29:32,506 --> 01:29:33,474
Thank you.

841
01:30:19,520 --> 01:30:21,422
Been waiting for you, yes?

842
01:30:22,156 --> 01:30:26,427
-What are you doing?
-l'm just making a few changes.

843
01:30:26,493 --> 01:30:31,398
-We're sure that's what we want?
-l'll take my chances.

844
01:30:31,465 --> 01:30:37,237
l'm dying, John. Your imprint
is not agreeable with my kind.

845
01:30:37,304 --> 01:30:39,473
But l wanted to know
what it was like.

846
01:30:41,208 --> 01:30:42,810
How you feel.

847
01:30:42,876 --> 01:30:45,546
You know how l was
supposed to feel.

848
01:30:45,612 --> 01:30:49,683
That person isn't me.
Never was.

849
01:30:49,750 --> 01:30:52,920
You wanted to know what it was
that makes us human.

850
01:30:54,054 --> 01:30:57,791
Well, you're not going to
find it in here.

851
01:30:59,460 --> 01:31:01,228
You went looking
in the wrong place.

852
01:32:40,461 --> 01:32:42,229
lt's so beautiful here.

853
01:32:47,735 --> 01:32:48,969
So bright.

854
01:32:55,275 --> 01:32:57,311
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

855
01:32:58,078 --> 01:33:00,414
l think that's it over there.

856
01:33:18,699 --> 01:33:20,667
l'm headed that way myself.

857
01:33:22,669 --> 01:33:24,004
Would you like to join me?

858
01:33:27,174 --> 01:33:28,142
Sure.

859
01:33:33,614 --> 01:33:37,117
l'm Anna, by the way.
What's your name?

860
01:33:52,066 --> 01:33:54,368
First, there was darkness.

861
01:33:55,903 --> 01:33:58,806
Then came the Strangers.

862
01:33:58,839 --> 01:34:01,575
They were a race
as old as time itself.

863
01:34:02,676 --> 01:34:05,345
They had mastered
the ultimate technology--

864
01:34:05,379 --> 01:34:10,651
the ability to alter
physical reality by will alone.

865
01:34:10,684 --> 01:34:13,320
They called this ability
''Tuning.''

866
01:34:14,488 --> 01:34:16,356
But they were dying.

867
01:34:16,390 --> 01:34:19,393
Their civilization was
in decline,

868
01:34:19,460 --> 01:34:22,196
and so they abandoned
their world,

869
01:34:22,229 --> 01:34:24,898
seeking a cure
for their own mortality.

870
01:34:26,266 --> 01:34:29,737
Their endless journey brought
them to a small, blue world...

871
01:34:29,803 --> 01:34:31,939
in the farthest corner
of the galaxy.

872
01:34:32,940 --> 01:34:34,408
Our world.

873
01:34:35,442 --> 01:34:37,444
Here, they thought
they had finally found...

874
01:34:37,511 --> 01:34:39,446
what they had been
searching for.

875
01:34:50,257 --> 01:34:53,160
My name is
Dr. Daniel Poe Schreber.

876
01:34:54,128 --> 01:34:55,796
l am just a man.

877
01:34:55,829 --> 01:34:58,665
l help the Strangers
conduct their experiments.

878
01:35:00,200 --> 01:35:02,236
l have betrayed my own kind.

879
01:38:29,710 --> 01:38:31,512
You are confused, aren't you?

880
01:38:31,545 --> 01:38:34,348
Frightened. That's all right.
l can help you.

881
01:38:34,381 --> 01:38:35,949
-Who is this?
-l'm a doctor.

882
01:38:36,016 --> 01:38:38,752
You must listen to me.
You have lost your memory.

883
01:38:38,786 --> 01:38:40,921
There was an experiment.
Something went wrong.

884
01:38:40,954 --> 01:38:43,123
Your memory was erased.
Do you understand me?

885
01:38:43,157 --> 01:38:45,192
No, l don't understand.
What's going on here?

886
01:38:45,259 --> 01:38:48,062
There are people coming for you
as we speak.

887
01:38:48,095 --> 01:38:50,397
Don't let them find you.
Leave now.

888
01:38:51,565 --> 01:38:53,767
Hello? Are you there?

889
01:39:35,909 --> 01:39:38,379
Hey, Mr. Murdoch,
the Automat called.

890
01:39:38,412 --> 01:39:39,913
Said you left your wallet there.

891
01:39:40,981 --> 01:39:44,618
l suggest you retrieve it, since
you only paid for three weeks,

892
01:39:44,651 --> 01:39:46,420
and they was up 10 minutes ago.

893
01:39:48,489 --> 01:39:49,957
l've been here three weeks?

894
01:39:49,990 --> 01:39:53,160
lt's right there
in black and white, Mr. Murdoch.

895
01:39:53,193 --> 01:39:55,596
Day and date.

896
01:39:55,629 --> 01:39:58,966
We make our books like we make
our beds, all neat and tidy.

897
01:39:58,999 --> 01:40:01,969
-l'll take care of it later.
-See that you do.

898
01:40:02,036 --> 01:40:04,171
Only thing makes you a guest
in this joint...

899
01:40:04,204 --> 01:40:05,572
is cash on the barrelhead!

900
01:40:23,457 --> 01:40:26,193
House rules.
Three weeks is three weeks.

901
01:40:26,226 --> 01:40:28,729
No days off for good behavior.

902
01:40:39,673 --> 01:40:43,343
Mr. Murdoch, yes?
Where is he?

903
01:40:43,377 --> 01:40:46,814
He just left
not five minutes ago.

904
01:40:48,215 --> 01:40:49,950
Sleep now.

905
01:40:52,553 --> 01:40:56,557
When the rumba rhythm
start to play

906
01:40:56,623 --> 01:40:58,792
Dance with me

907
01:40:58,826 --> 01:41:01,862
Make me sway

908
01:41:01,929 --> 01:41:05,866
Like a lazy ocean hugs the shore

909
01:41:05,933 --> 01:41:08,168
Hold me close

910
01:41:08,202 --> 01:41:11,038
Sway me more

911
01:41:11,071 --> 01:41:15,342
Like a flower bending
in the breeze

912
01:41:15,376 --> 01:41:17,811
Bend with me

913
01:41:17,845 --> 01:41:20,681
Sway with ease

914
01:41:20,714 --> 01:41:24,651
When we dance,
you have a way with me

915
01:41:24,718 --> 01:41:27,187
Stay with me

916
01:41:27,221 --> 01:41:29,757
Sway with me

917
01:41:30,557 --> 01:41:34,595
Hey, sweetie, he said he was
your husband's doctor.

918
01:41:34,661 --> 01:41:36,196
He wanted to speak with you.

919
01:41:56,417 --> 01:41:57,684
Excuse me.

920
01:41:59,653 --> 01:42:01,188
-Doctor...
-Schreber.

921
01:42:01,255 --> 01:42:05,259
Please, won't you come in?
You must be Emma Murdoch.

922
01:42:06,627 --> 01:42:10,030
Thank you for coming to see me
on such short notice.

923
01:42:10,064 --> 01:42:11,532
What is this?

924
01:42:11,565 --> 01:42:15,169
A rather crude experiment
designed to further my studies.

925
01:42:15,202 --> 01:42:18,872
l don't understand. You say
you're my husband's doctor,

926
01:42:18,906 --> 01:42:21,442
but he never
mentioned you to me.

927
01:42:21,508 --> 01:42:24,311
The truth is, John has been
coming to see me...

928
01:42:24,344 --> 01:42:25,779
for quite some time.

929
01:42:25,813 --> 01:42:29,183
He had been grappling
with feelings of betrayal...

930
01:42:29,216 --> 01:42:32,252
stemming from
your marital difficulties.

931
01:42:32,319 --> 01:42:34,221
-John told you what happened.
-Yes.

932
01:42:35,622 --> 01:42:37,891
When was the last time
that you saw him?

933
01:42:37,925 --> 01:42:40,828
Three weeks ago.
He packed a suitcase.

934
01:42:40,861 --> 01:42:43,330
He was very angry at me.

935
01:42:43,397 --> 01:42:46,233
l understand how difficult
this must be for you,

936
01:42:46,266 --> 01:42:47,634
but for John's sake,

937
01:42:47,668 --> 01:42:50,604
l would like you to think of me
as your friend, Emma.

938
01:42:50,637 --> 01:42:54,308
lt appears that John
has suffered a psychotic break.

939
01:42:54,341 --> 01:42:57,478
-Complete memory loss.
-You can't be serious.

940
01:42:57,511 --> 01:43:00,481
Oh, but l am.
He may be delusional.

941
01:43:00,514 --> 01:43:01,782
Even violent.

942
01:43:03,150 --> 01:43:07,087
lf he were to contact you,
you must call me immediately.

943
01:43:07,121 --> 01:43:09,590
Wherever your husband is,
he is searching...

944
01:43:11,358 --> 01:43:12,559
For himself.

945
01:43:22,736 --> 01:43:26,607
Good evening, Mr. Murdoch.
lt is Mr. Murdoch, isn't it?

946
01:43:27,574 --> 01:43:31,011
Mr. ''J'' something Murdoch?

947
01:43:34,381 --> 01:43:38,585
J. Murdoch. What's your name?
Justin? Jerry?

948
01:43:42,856 --> 01:43:44,958
My name's Jason Murdoch.
John Murdoch.

949
01:43:44,992 --> 01:43:47,594
Jake Murdoch. How's it going?
Hi. Jack Murdoch.

950
01:43:53,934 --> 01:43:55,703
Got to get a grip on myself.

951
01:44:19,793 --> 01:44:23,163
l told the guy,
cash on the barrelhead.

952
01:44:23,197 --> 01:44:26,500
l said, ''Listen,
three weeks is three weeks.''

953
01:44:26,533 --> 01:44:30,137
-Where's our lucky winner?
-Upstairs, sir. Room 614.

954
01:44:31,372 --> 01:44:32,706
The call girl.

955
01:44:37,344 --> 01:44:40,247
-Evening, Husselbeck.
-lnspector Bumstead.

956
01:44:40,280 --> 01:44:42,015
Your lace is untied.

957
01:44:43,283 --> 01:44:44,518
Sorry.

958
01:44:52,960 --> 01:44:54,495
Am l glad you're here, sir.

959
01:44:54,561 --> 01:44:57,197
They say Detective Walenski's
got the heebie-jeebies.

960
01:44:57,231 --> 01:44:59,433
Just take what they give me,
Husselbeck.

961
01:45:30,330 --> 01:45:32,833
-Thanks a lot.
-Excuse me.

962
01:45:35,302 --> 01:45:37,071
-Hello?
-Oh, it's you.

963
01:45:37,805 --> 01:45:40,507
-You left your wallet here.
-When did l do that?

964
01:45:40,541 --> 01:45:42,743
-When you was last here.
-When was that?

965
01:45:42,776 --> 01:45:46,180
When you left your wallet.
Expect me to remember?

966
01:45:51,985 --> 01:45:54,755
-Excuse me!
-No, no, seriously.

967
01:46:12,139 --> 01:46:13,974
-Where you headed, chief?
-Home.

968
01:46:14,007 --> 01:46:15,342
And where's home?

969
01:46:15,376 --> 01:46:18,145
Haven't you mugs got
anything better to do?

970
01:46:18,178 --> 01:46:20,447
l'm just doing my job, May.

971
01:46:20,481 --> 01:46:22,516
There's a killer out there.

972
01:46:22,583 --> 01:46:25,252
Look for him
instead of cooling your heels.

973
01:46:28,555 --> 01:46:30,290
Go on. Get out of here.

974
01:46:39,233 --> 01:46:40,267
Come on.

975
01:46:43,537 --> 01:46:46,340
What's that make so far?
Six hookers in all?

976
01:46:46,373 --> 01:46:49,276
-l believe so, sir.
-Give the man an ''A'' for effort.

977
01:46:54,681 --> 01:46:56,984
So, Husselbeck,

978
01:46:57,017 --> 01:47:03,457
what kind of killer do you think
stops to save a dying fish?

979
01:47:03,524 --> 01:47:05,426
-Got me, sir.
-Bumstead.

980
01:47:05,459 --> 01:47:08,729
What took you? This killer's
been running circles around us,

981
01:47:08,762 --> 01:47:09,863
thanks to Walenski.

982
01:47:09,930 --> 01:47:11,732
With all due respect,
Chief lnspector,

983
01:47:11,765 --> 01:47:14,802
l've known Eddie a long time,
and he's a good cop.

984
01:47:14,868 --> 01:47:17,104
Whatever kind of cop
Walenski once was...

985
01:47:17,137 --> 01:47:19,073
he let drift a long time ago.

986
01:47:19,106 --> 01:47:20,874
Let me talk to Bumstead!

987
01:47:20,908 --> 01:47:22,943
Come on! Hold on!

988
01:47:23,644 --> 01:47:24,812
Frank!

989
01:47:27,881 --> 01:47:29,917
-Get his arm !
-They're watching us!

990
01:47:29,983 --> 01:47:32,252
-On your feet!
-There's no way out!

991
01:47:33,654 --> 01:47:35,356
God, can't you see?

992
01:47:38,759 --> 01:47:41,128
Let me go!
l'm not going to hurt you.

993
01:47:42,663 --> 01:47:44,865
-What was that?
-Walenski.

994
01:47:53,273 --> 01:47:56,377
l'm being punished
for my sins, right?

995
01:47:56,443 --> 01:48:00,748
What did l ever do to inherit
this? Where do you begin?

996
01:48:00,781 --> 01:48:03,717
Well, everything Detective
Walenski committed to paper...

997
01:48:03,751 --> 01:48:05,185
should be here, so--

998
01:48:05,219 --> 01:48:07,855
The only thing that should be
committed is Walenski.

999
01:48:10,157 --> 01:48:12,026
Nothing like
a little healthy paranoia.

1000
01:48:18,565 --> 01:48:21,902
l came here to file a missing
persons report for my husband.

1001
01:48:21,935 --> 01:48:25,372
-Take it to the front desk.
-They told me to come see you.

1002
01:48:27,641 --> 01:48:29,309
His name's John Murdoch.

1003
01:48:32,379 --> 01:48:35,716
Do these names mean
anything to you?

1004
01:48:36,550 --> 01:48:38,519
Who are these women?

1005
01:48:38,552 --> 01:48:40,421
Why are you looking
for my husband?

1006
01:48:40,454 --> 01:48:42,723
Are you going to accuse him
of something?

1007
01:48:42,756 --> 01:48:46,293
-Maybe. Maybe murder.
-Whose murder?

1008
01:48:47,728 --> 01:48:50,964
-Which one?
-All of them.

1009
01:48:52,399 --> 01:48:55,703
Mrs. Murdoch, l am sorry.
l didn't mean to alarm you.

1010
01:48:55,736 --> 01:48:58,472
l'm sorry that l came.
l just made a mistake.

1011
01:48:58,505 --> 01:49:02,276
lf you'd please just give me
half a second to explain.

1012
01:49:11,652 --> 01:49:12,920
We met before?

1013
01:49:14,588 --> 01:49:17,591
lf we did,
l hope you're still breathing.

1014
01:49:17,658 --> 01:49:19,226
What's your name, honey?

1015
01:49:23,030 --> 01:49:24,798
Well, that's
an appropriate name.

1016
01:49:32,740 --> 01:49:34,041
l was just thinking.

1017
01:49:38,245 --> 01:49:39,780
What you do...

1018
01:49:41,014 --> 01:49:46,053
lt seems kind of dangerous...
right now.

1019
01:49:46,120 --> 01:49:48,055
How do you know
l'm not the killer?

1020
01:49:48,088 --> 01:49:51,358
You don't seem like
the killer type. Why?

1021
01:49:52,292 --> 01:49:54,495
You feeling any urges
l should know about?

1022
01:50:06,607 --> 01:50:07,775
Shoot.

1023
01:50:55,422 --> 01:50:59,293
So it seems you've discovered
your unpleasant nature.

1024
01:50:59,326 --> 01:51:03,130
-Who are you?
-We might ask the same question.

1025
01:51:04,131 --> 01:51:06,367
Sleep...now.

1026
01:51:31,892 --> 01:51:33,093
He can Tune!

1027
01:52:26,280 --> 01:52:29,450
What is to be done?
This man is dangerous.

1028
01:52:29,483 --> 01:52:32,619
-lt is said he is able to Tune.
-lmpossible!

1029
01:52:32,653 --> 01:52:35,689
We have seen it
with our own eyes.

1030
01:52:35,756 --> 01:52:38,592
On occasion, the imprinting
does not take.

1031
01:52:38,625 --> 01:52:41,128
They behave erratically
when they awaken.

1032
01:52:41,195 --> 01:52:44,865
We find them wandering
like lost children.

1033
01:52:44,898 --> 01:52:47,067
But this one was different, yes?

1034
01:52:47,101 --> 01:52:50,838
-What has the doctor to say?
-He has failed to report in.

1035
01:52:50,871 --> 01:52:54,007
-And Mr. Quick?
-No more Mr. Quick.

1036
01:52:54,041 --> 01:52:56,677
Mr. Quick...dead, yes.

1037
01:53:00,047 --> 01:53:02,683
Poor, poor Mr. Quick.

1038
01:53:02,716 --> 01:53:05,652
Mr. Book...does he know?

1039
01:53:06,653 --> 01:53:08,689
Should we not know, Mr. Hand?

1040
01:53:09,723 --> 01:53:12,626
We had hoped to learn more
before sharing with you.

1041
01:53:12,659 --> 01:53:15,596
We can know nothing
until we possess him.

1042
01:53:15,629 --> 01:53:17,898
We must have this man.

1043
01:53:23,837 --> 01:53:25,005
My brand, l hope.

1044
01:53:37,317 --> 01:53:38,886
l've been worried about you.

1045
01:53:42,923 --> 01:53:44,258
Are you punishing me?

1046
01:53:45,025 --> 01:53:47,661
lf disappearing is
your way of punishing me,

1047
01:53:47,695 --> 01:53:48,896
l don't appreciate it.

1048
01:53:48,929 --> 01:53:50,097
What are you talking about?

1049
01:53:53,600 --> 01:53:57,404
l found these keys in my pocket,
so l assume l live here.

1050
01:53:59,573 --> 01:54:01,909
-You supposed to be my wife?
-''Supposed to be''?

1051
01:54:05,446 --> 01:54:09,450
You really...don't know
who l am, do you.

1052
01:54:10,317 --> 01:54:13,120
Your doctor called me. He was
worried that this might happen.

1053
01:54:13,153 --> 01:54:14,455
My doctor?

1054
01:54:17,391 --> 01:54:21,095
He gave me his card.
He's desperate to find you.

1055
01:54:28,836 --> 01:54:30,838
Feel like l'm living out
someone else's nightmare.

1056
01:54:30,904 --> 01:54:33,707
What happened to me?
Why was l seeing a doctor?

1057
01:54:34,274 --> 01:54:35,776
l had an affair.

1058
01:54:37,678 --> 01:54:39,046
You were angry at me.

1059
01:54:42,216 --> 01:54:45,886
Closing time.
The pool is now closed.

1060
01:54:55,596 --> 01:54:57,931
Most unfortunate it is...

1061
01:54:57,965 --> 01:55:00,267
that we were forced
to seek you out here.

1062
01:55:01,235 --> 01:55:05,406
You know how uncomfortable
we find all this moisture.

1063
01:55:06,273 --> 01:55:09,576
-l'm sorry. l--
-Failed to report in, yes?

1064
01:55:09,610 --> 01:55:12,546
l was frightened.
l have a weak heart, you know.

1065
01:55:12,579 --> 01:55:16,083
Your weakness is not, we think,
an affair of the heart.

1066
01:55:16,150 --> 01:55:18,819
We found this in his hotel room.

1067
01:55:18,852 --> 01:55:22,356
Must we reproduce
Mr. Murdoch's memories again?

1068
01:55:22,423 --> 01:55:24,525
l tried to reprint him,
but he woke up.

1069
01:55:24,591 --> 01:55:26,794
He knocked the syringe
right out of my hand.

1070
01:55:26,827 --> 01:55:30,030
-He has no memories, then?
-Only fragments.

1071
01:55:30,064 --> 01:55:31,565
The procedure,
it was interrupted.

1072
01:55:31,632 --> 01:55:34,334
l guess it's only a matter
of rounding him up.

1073
01:55:35,069 --> 01:55:36,804
You have had strays
before, right?

1074
01:55:36,837 --> 01:55:40,708
This is no stray, Doctor.
This one can Tune.

1075
01:55:40,741 --> 01:55:43,777
But that's impossible.
Only you have that ability.

1076
01:55:43,844 --> 01:55:46,146
You will process
another template...

1077
01:55:46,180 --> 01:55:48,215
of the subject's memories, yes?

1078
01:55:48,282 --> 01:55:49,817
Of course.
l'll imprint him again.

1079
01:55:51,452 --> 01:55:54,688
We require them
for a quite different purpose.

1080
01:55:54,722 --> 01:55:57,524
lt's almost midnight,
Dr. Schreber.

1081
01:55:57,558 --> 01:55:59,393
We'll talk again
after tonight's Tuning,

1082
01:55:59,426 --> 01:56:02,363
but no more delays, yes?

1083
01:56:02,396 --> 01:56:07,201
No more inconsistencies
in your behavior.

1084
01:56:09,069 --> 01:56:10,738
The police were looking for you.

1085
01:56:10,771 --> 01:56:12,906
l know. l saw the papers.

1086
01:56:12,973 --> 01:56:15,442
''Killer stalks
city street-walkers.''

1087
01:56:19,079 --> 01:56:21,382
l was with one of those women.

1088
01:56:22,916 --> 01:56:26,353
-Before l came here tonight.
-l don't understand.

1089
01:56:26,387 --> 01:56:31,325
l met her outside an Automat.
l guess l wanted to test myself.

1090
01:56:33,027 --> 01:56:36,430
l wanted to know if l had it
in me to do those things.

1091
01:56:36,463 --> 01:56:37,931
Maybe l have lost my mind,

1092
01:56:37,998 --> 01:56:40,968
but whoever l am, l'm still me,
and l'm not a killer.

1093
01:56:47,007 --> 01:56:48,308
l believe you.

1094
01:56:50,210 --> 01:56:51,412
You do?

1095
01:56:55,983 --> 01:56:57,951
-What?
-The car outside.

1096
01:56:58,018 --> 01:56:59,453
The one you arrived in.

1097
01:56:59,486 --> 01:57:01,789
lt's a cop.
He dropped me off here.

1098
01:57:03,957 --> 01:57:05,726
l didn't know he was still here.

1099
01:57:09,296 --> 01:57:10,764
Hold it right there, mister!

1100
01:57:13,167 --> 01:57:16,170
-Wait. You have the wrong man.
-Stand aside, will you, please?

1101
01:57:16,236 --> 01:57:17,705
l didn't kill anyone.

1102
01:57:17,738 --> 01:57:20,040
Right now,
all you are is a suspect.

1103
01:57:20,074 --> 01:57:23,277
Turn yourself in. l'll listen
to whatever you have to say.

1104
01:57:23,310 --> 01:57:25,379
You won't believe
what l have to say.

1105
01:57:26,547 --> 01:57:29,817
-Try me.
-There's someone after me.

1106
01:57:29,850 --> 01:57:33,454
lt's this group of men.
They want me dead.

1107
01:57:33,520 --> 01:57:36,390
And l don't even know if...
they're not even--

1108
01:57:36,423 --> 01:57:38,659
Yeah, who's going to listen
to a madman?

1109
01:57:38,692 --> 01:57:41,161
-Stand aside, Mrs. Murdoch.
-Run!

1110
01:57:45,499 --> 01:57:47,468
No one ever listens to me.

1111
01:57:53,774 --> 01:57:54,808
Murdoch, stop!

1112
01:58:37,718 --> 01:58:40,020
-How much further?
-We're almost there, buddy.

1113
01:58:43,590 --> 01:58:45,959
You happen to know
the way to Shell Beach?

1114
01:58:45,993 --> 01:58:49,029
You're kidding! Me and the wife
spent our honeymoon there.

1115
01:58:49,096 --> 01:58:51,598
All you do is
take Main Street West to...

1116
01:58:54,601 --> 01:58:57,838
Or is it the Cross...
Now, that's funny.

1117
01:58:57,871 --> 01:59:00,974
l can't seem to remember
if it's Main Street West...

1118
01:59:01,041 --> 01:59:02,343
or the Crosstown.

1119
01:59:07,014 --> 01:59:10,050
l'm sorry, lnspector,
l cannot be of more assistance,

1120
01:59:10,117 --> 01:59:12,086
but l am running late
for an appointment.

1121
01:59:12,119 --> 01:59:14,254
Well, l appreciate you
taking the time.

1122
01:59:22,996 --> 01:59:25,399
There's just one thing
that puzzles me.

1123
01:59:25,432 --> 01:59:29,970
l've met quite a few murderers
in the course of my work.

1124
01:59:30,037 --> 01:59:32,740
Murdoch doesn't
strike me as one.

1125
01:59:32,773 --> 01:59:35,976
Perhaps you are not accustomed
to digging deep enough.

1126
01:59:36,010 --> 01:59:38,879
Well, l do know when
someone is lying to me, Doctor.

1127
01:59:38,912 --> 01:59:43,117
lnspector, judging personalities
happens to be my business.

1128
01:59:43,150 --> 01:59:45,119
Maybe you can give me
a few pointers.

1129
01:59:45,185 --> 01:59:49,123
Certainly.
Let's take you, for instance.

1130
01:59:49,156 --> 01:59:52,259
You are a fastidious man.
Driven.

1131
01:59:52,326 --> 01:59:54,628
Consumed by details.

1132
01:59:54,661 --> 01:59:58,132
l would say
your life is rather lonely.

1133
01:59:58,198 --> 02:00:00,734
Good evening, lnspector.
l really must be going.

1134
02:00:38,539 --> 02:00:39,606
Come in.

1135
02:00:44,645 --> 02:00:46,447
-How is he?
-The same.

1136
02:00:47,715 --> 02:00:50,384
Walenski? lt's me, Frank.

1137
02:00:56,757 --> 02:00:57,958
Come in, Frank.

1138
02:01:01,195 --> 02:01:02,429
Close the door.

1139
02:01:10,471 --> 02:01:13,774
l've been looking through
some of your old reports.

1140
