02:01:13,807 --> 02:01:15,876
lt's an interesting case.

1141
02:01:17,011 --> 02:01:20,214
Kind that make a man's career.

1142
02:01:21,915 --> 02:01:25,586
-Or break it.
-Yeah. l was on that case.

1143
02:01:25,619 --> 02:01:29,456
And then what?
What happened then, Eddie?

1144
02:01:29,490 --> 02:01:30,924
Nothing happened, Frank.

1145
02:01:31,925 --> 02:01:33,927
l've just been spending time
in the subway,

1146
02:01:33,994 --> 02:01:35,896
riding in circles.

1147
02:01:35,929 --> 02:01:39,466
Thinking in circles.
There's no way out.

1148
02:01:41,735 --> 02:01:43,437
l've been over this entire city.

1149
02:01:47,908 --> 02:01:49,810
You're scaring your wife
to death, Eddie.

1150
02:01:49,843 --> 02:01:51,311
She's not my wife.

1151
02:01:53,180 --> 02:01:56,150
l don't know who she is
or who any of us are.

1152
02:01:56,183 --> 02:01:59,553
-What makes you say that?
-You think about the past much?

1153
02:02:01,622 --> 02:02:03,090
As much as the next guy.

1154
02:02:04,124 --> 02:02:06,860
See, l've been trying
to remember things--

1155
02:02:06,894 --> 02:02:09,963
clearly remember things
from my past.

1156
02:02:10,030 --> 02:02:12,166
But the more
l try to think back,

1157
02:02:12,232 --> 02:02:15,202
the more it all starts
to unravel.

1158
02:02:15,269 --> 02:02:16,437
None of it seems real.

1159
02:02:16,470 --> 02:02:20,641
lt's like l've just
been dreaming this life,

1160
02:02:20,674 --> 02:02:23,644
and when l finally wake up,
l'll be somebody else,

1161
02:02:23,677 --> 02:02:25,646
somebody totally different.

1162
02:02:30,050 --> 02:02:32,186
You saw something,
didn't you, Eddie.

1163
02:02:33,354 --> 02:02:35,856
Something to do with the case.

1164
02:02:36,457 --> 02:02:39,860
There is no case!
There never was!

1165
02:02:39,893 --> 02:02:43,797
lt's all just a big joke!
lt's a joke!

1166
02:03:24,872 --> 02:03:26,607
Tonight's requirements are...

1167
02:03:26,640 --> 02:03:29,910
12 family photo albums,

1168
02:03:29,943 --> 02:03:32,346
nine personal diaries,

1169
02:03:32,379 --> 02:03:34,515
17 love letters,

1170
02:03:34,581 --> 02:03:36,984
assorted childhood photographs,

1171
02:03:37,017 --> 02:03:41,221
requisite false l.D.s
and social security cards.

1172
02:03:41,255 --> 02:03:43,524
These do bring back memories.

1173
02:03:45,893 --> 02:03:48,162
This one is still warm.

1174
02:03:48,962 --> 02:03:50,064
What is it?

1175
02:03:50,130 --> 02:03:53,334
The recollections of
a great lover?

1176
02:03:53,367 --> 02:03:55,669
A catalogue of conquests?

1177
02:03:56,403 --> 02:03:57,871
We will soon find out.

1178
02:03:59,173 --> 02:04:00,641
You wouldn't
appreciate that,

1179
02:04:00,708 --> 02:04:03,944
would you,
Mr. Whatever-your-name is?

1180
02:04:03,977 --> 02:04:08,282
Not the sort of conquest
you would ever understand.

1181
02:04:09,083 --> 02:04:10,351
Let's see.

1182
02:04:11,652 --> 02:04:14,355
A touch of
unhappy childhood...

1183
02:04:20,027 --> 02:04:22,596
A dash of
teenage rebellion...

1184
02:04:24,198 --> 02:04:27,267
And last but not least...

1185
02:04:27,334 --> 02:04:29,903
a tragic death
in the family.

1186
02:04:32,773 --> 02:04:34,441
Mr. Book.

1187
02:04:41,415 --> 02:04:44,985
Why does Murdoch not sleep
during the Tuning?

1188
02:04:45,052 --> 02:04:49,323
Maybe he's a step up
the evolutionary ladder.

1189
02:04:49,356 --> 02:04:50,557
A freak of nature.

1190
02:04:50,591 --> 02:04:53,460
He's adapting to survive.
What do you expect?

1191
02:04:53,494 --> 02:04:55,396
Weren't you looking for
the human soul?

1192
02:04:55,429 --> 02:04:58,032
lsn't that the purpose
of your little zoo?

1193
02:04:58,098 --> 02:05:01,435
That's why you change people
and things every night.

1194
02:05:01,468 --> 02:05:04,371
Maybe you have finally
found what you are looking for,

1195
02:05:04,405 --> 02:05:05,939
and it's going to bite you
on your--

1196
02:05:09,977 --> 02:05:11,912
lt requires several
of your lifetimes...

1197
02:05:11,945 --> 02:05:13,580
to master our gifts.

1198
02:05:13,647 --> 02:05:15,482
The idea that
a simple man...

1199
02:05:15,516 --> 02:05:17,484
could develop the ability
to Tune is--

1200
02:05:17,551 --> 02:05:18,652
Absurd, l know.

1201
02:05:18,719 --> 02:05:21,021
What other explanation is there?

1202
02:05:25,993 --> 02:05:27,161
lt is time.

1203
02:06:13,073 --> 02:06:14,508
Shut it down.

1204
02:06:33,060 --> 02:06:36,130
Fredrickson says he'll take me
off the night shift.

1205
02:06:36,196 --> 02:06:38,065
lt's about time, dear.

1206
02:07:28,816 --> 02:07:29,783
Hello?

1207
02:07:38,092 --> 02:07:39,460
Wake up.

1208
02:07:42,563 --> 02:07:44,031
Wake up!

1209
02:07:54,141 --> 02:07:56,276
Can anyone hear me?

1210
02:07:59,446 --> 02:08:02,282
Let the Tuning commence.

1211
02:10:42,142 --> 02:10:43,510
The Goodwins.

1212
02:10:43,544 --> 02:10:45,512
Charlie, Sylvia,

1213
02:10:45,579 --> 02:10:47,648
Jane, and little Matthew.

1214
02:10:51,552 --> 02:10:53,721
Jane and little Matthew.

1215
02:11:23,917 --> 02:11:26,153
The rich get richer.

1216
02:11:26,186 --> 02:11:28,288
Probably have
maid's quarters...

1217
02:11:28,355 --> 02:11:29,723
before the night
is through.

1218
02:12:23,277 --> 02:12:25,245
Dr. Schreber, l presume.

1219
02:12:25,279 --> 02:12:26,747
lt's you.

1220
02:12:26,814 --> 02:12:27,848
Hey, come on.

1221
02:12:27,915 --> 02:12:29,983
That's no way to greet
a patient, Doctor,

1222
02:12:30,050 --> 02:12:32,186
if that's what you are.

1223
02:12:32,252 --> 02:12:33,687
Please, l--

1224
02:12:33,721 --> 02:12:35,556
Why is everyone asleep?

1225
02:12:35,589 --> 02:12:37,992
Please keep your voice down.

1226
02:12:38,025 --> 02:12:39,960
l can't remember anything.
What have you done?

1227
02:12:39,994 --> 02:12:42,796
Nothing. l want to help you.

1228
02:12:42,830 --> 02:12:46,233
We cannot talk here.
lf they see us together--

1229
02:12:46,266 --> 02:12:49,169
l don't care.
l want some answers. Now!

1230
02:12:49,203 --> 02:12:52,306
Who are they?
Why are they trying to kill me?

1231
02:12:52,373 --> 02:12:53,474
Answer me!

1232
02:12:58,612 --> 02:12:59,613
My God.

1233
02:12:59,680 --> 02:13:02,716
-You really can do it.
-l did that?

1234
02:13:02,783 --> 02:13:05,352
Listen to me.
You have their power.

1235
02:13:05,419 --> 02:13:07,388
You can make things happen
by will alone.

1236
02:13:07,421 --> 02:13:08,989
They call it ''Tuning.''

1237
02:13:09,056 --> 02:13:11,025
That is how they change
the buildings.

1238
02:13:11,058 --> 02:13:13,560
Just now you acted
out of self-defense,

1239
02:13:13,627 --> 02:13:16,397
but l can teach you
to control your power.

1240
02:13:16,430 --> 02:13:20,401
We can stop them.
We can take the city back.

1241
02:13:23,737 --> 02:13:25,205
My glasses.

1242
02:14:19,460 --> 02:14:21,795
He made a terrible impression
for the firm,

1243
02:14:21,829 --> 02:14:24,665
lollygagging around
as he did.

1244
02:14:24,698 --> 02:14:27,601
So l told Fredrickson
l was letting him go.

1245
02:14:27,634 --> 02:14:29,603
Well you should have, darling.

1246
02:14:30,371 --> 02:14:33,407
He attacked me.
l don't know where he's gone.

1247
02:14:33,941 --> 02:14:37,878
Come, Dr. Schreber.
We have much to do.

1248
02:14:37,945 --> 02:14:40,514
-Yes?
-Yes.

1249
02:14:42,950 --> 02:14:49,356
They say that
you're a runaround lover

1250
02:14:50,457 --> 02:14:58,465
Though you say it isn't so

1251
02:15:01,402 --> 02:15:08,242
But if you put me down
for another

1252
02:15:09,843 --> 02:15:15,716
l'll know, believe me, l'll know

1253
02:15:17,184 --> 02:15:20,688
Tonight's experiment will
take place in these locations.

1254
02:15:20,754 --> 02:15:24,758
The first subject
shall be imprinted on Avenue M.

1255
02:15:24,825 --> 02:15:27,795
Mr. Book, there is a problem.

1256
02:15:27,861 --> 02:15:29,430
There is no Avenue M.

1257
02:15:29,496 --> 02:15:31,365
We were unable
to complete it.

1258
02:15:31,398 --> 02:15:34,868
During the last Tuning,
we detected a lack of control.

1259
02:15:34,935 --> 02:15:38,172
An opposing influence
on the machines?

1260
02:15:38,205 --> 02:15:42,443
This man Murdoch is
more powerful than we thought.

1261
02:15:42,476 --> 02:15:44,411
He is becoming like us.

1262
02:15:44,445 --> 02:15:47,881
So we must become like him.

1263
02:15:48,816 --> 02:15:51,151
The doctor has done as we asked?

1264
02:15:51,185 --> 02:15:54,888
The life and times
of John Murdoch, volume two.

1265
02:15:56,890 --> 02:15:59,460
We must not do this.

1266
02:15:59,526 --> 02:16:02,896
Murdoch does not possess
these memories, yes?

1267
02:16:02,930 --> 02:16:05,766
How will his imprint
allow us to find him?

1268
02:16:05,799 --> 02:16:09,236
Everywhere he goes,
everyone he seeks out...

1269
02:16:09,269 --> 02:16:10,537
will be known to us.

1270
02:16:10,571 --> 02:16:15,676
And as he follows the clues,
so shall we follow the memories.

1271
02:16:15,743 --> 02:16:18,178
But to imprint one of us?

1272
02:16:18,212 --> 02:16:20,914
Failure has always resulted.

1273
02:16:20,948 --> 02:16:24,485
What Mr. Hand proposes
is our only option.

1274
02:16:24,551 --> 02:16:26,153
lmprint.

1275
02:16:31,592 --> 02:16:33,527
This may sting a bit.

1276
02:17:10,030 --> 02:17:11,699
ls it done?

1277
02:17:11,765 --> 02:17:14,201
Oh, yes, Mr. Book.

1278
02:17:14,234 --> 02:17:18,072
l have John Murdoch in mind.

1279
02:17:18,706 --> 02:17:20,307
''Johnny...

1280
02:17:20,374 --> 02:17:24,345
''Found this postcard
among your mother's things.

1281
02:17:24,411 --> 02:17:26,647
''Brings back memories,
doesn't it?

1282
02:17:26,680 --> 02:17:28,549
''Stop by sometime.

1283
02:17:28,582 --> 02:17:31,852
''We'll see if we can't
hook ourselves another mermaid.

1284
02:17:31,885 --> 02:17:34,221
''Love to Emma. Karl.''

1285
02:17:39,693 --> 02:17:40,661
Karl.

1286
02:17:42,563 --> 02:17:44,198
Karl Harris.

1287
02:17:52,373 --> 02:17:53,407
Harris.

1288
02:18:01,715 --> 02:18:04,752
Excuse me.
Which way is Avenue C?

1289
02:18:04,818 --> 02:18:06,053
Try the subway.

1290
02:18:09,790 --> 02:18:11,258
You got a problem, pal?

1291
02:18:11,325 --> 02:18:14,161
Been working here long?

1292
02:18:14,194 --> 02:18:17,531
25 years.
No days off for good behavior.

1293
02:18:42,690 --> 02:18:45,626
We're looking for John Murdoch.

1294
02:19:19,827 --> 02:19:21,895
She knows nothing,
Mr. Hand.

1295
02:19:21,962 --> 02:19:23,831
A dead end, Mr. Wall.

1296
02:19:23,864 --> 02:19:26,600
We thought his imprint
would let us track him.

1297
02:19:26,633 --> 02:19:29,136
But instead
we have been brought here.

1298
02:19:29,203 --> 02:19:33,207
-This is irrational.
-lnstincts are irrational.

1299
02:19:33,273 --> 02:19:36,577
We must follow
where they lead, yes?

1300
02:19:36,610 --> 02:19:39,880
Mr. Sleep suggests he may go
to places familiar.

1301
02:19:39,913 --> 02:19:41,248
His job.

1302
02:19:41,281 --> 02:19:43,283
He does not care about our job.

1303
02:19:43,350 --> 02:19:46,186
lndulge us, Mr. Hand.

1304
02:19:46,220 --> 02:19:48,856
lf you were Murdoch, yes?

1305
02:19:48,922 --> 02:19:52,259
lf l were Murdoch...

1306
02:19:54,061 --> 02:19:57,531
l would remember how
my wife had hurt me...

1307
02:19:57,598 --> 02:19:59,600
by sleeping with another man.

1308
02:20:01,201 --> 02:20:02,670
And then...

1309
02:20:04,605 --> 02:20:08,008
l would look for a way
to hurt her in return.

1310
02:20:11,045 --> 02:20:15,582
Leave me alone with her.
There's work to be done.

1311
02:20:19,286 --> 02:20:21,355
All change,
platform three.

1312
02:20:24,058 --> 02:20:25,159
All change?

1313
02:20:25,225 --> 02:20:27,528
Excuse me, how do l get
to the end of the line?

1314
02:20:27,561 --> 02:20:29,029
You want the Express.

1315
02:20:41,642 --> 02:20:44,111
How come the train didn't stop?

1316
02:20:44,144 --> 02:20:45,446
That's the Express.

1317
02:20:46,981 --> 02:20:48,882
There's no way out.

1318
02:20:48,916 --> 02:20:51,752
You can't get out of the city.
l've tried.

1319
02:20:52,853 --> 02:20:54,922
You're Murdoch, aren't you?

1320
02:20:54,989 --> 02:20:56,623
The one
they've been looking for.

1321
02:20:56,690 --> 02:20:57,791
You're not a killer.

1322
02:20:57,858 --> 02:21:00,594
They set you up with
a fake identity,

1323
02:21:00,627 --> 02:21:02,229
like everyone else here.

1324
02:21:02,296 --> 02:21:04,198
-Who are you?
-l was a cop.

1325
02:21:04,231 --> 02:21:07,334
At least in this life l was.

1326
02:21:07,401 --> 02:21:10,270
They steal peoples' memories.

1327
02:21:10,304 --> 02:21:12,106
Then they swap them around
between us.

1328
02:21:12,139 --> 02:21:14,808
l seen them do it,
back and forth...

1329
02:21:14,875 --> 02:21:16,977
till no one knows
who they are anymore.

1330
02:21:17,044 --> 02:21:18,345
How do you know all this?

1331
02:21:18,379 --> 02:21:20,180
Once in a while one of us
wakes up...

1332
02:21:20,214 --> 02:21:21,649
while they're changing things.

1333
02:21:22,549 --> 02:21:25,019
lt's not supposed to happen,
but it does.

1334
02:21:25,085 --> 02:21:26,420
lt happened to me.

1335
02:21:27,121 --> 02:21:29,023
They'll come looking for you.

1336
02:21:30,157 --> 02:21:32,493
Just like they'll come
looking for me.

1337
02:21:32,526 --> 02:21:33,927
But that's OK.

1338
02:21:33,961 --> 02:21:35,195
l figured a way out.

1339
02:21:46,607 --> 02:21:47,875
They were here.

1340
02:21:49,943 --> 02:21:51,378
Last night.

1341
02:21:51,412 --> 02:21:53,647
This was to be his home.

1342
02:21:56,283 --> 02:21:58,118
That was when we loved her.

1343
02:21:58,152 --> 02:22:00,454
This is all well and good,

1344
02:22:00,487 --> 02:22:02,489
but we require
a more practical link...

1345
02:22:02,556 --> 02:22:04,591
to his present whereabouts.

1346
02:22:09,229 --> 02:22:11,231
And l know where to find her.

1347
02:22:19,707 --> 02:22:23,010
We're very lucky,
when you think about it.

1348
02:22:23,043 --> 02:22:24,044
l'm sorry?

1349
02:22:24,111 --> 02:22:26,146
To be able to revisit
those places...

1350
02:22:26,213 --> 02:22:28,182
which meant
so very much to us.

1351
02:22:29,049 --> 02:22:31,552
l thought we were haunted
by them.

1352
02:22:31,618 --> 02:22:33,354
Perhaps.

1353
02:22:33,387 --> 02:22:35,856
There used to be a ferry
when l was a boy.

1354
02:22:35,889 --> 02:22:37,925
Biggest thing you ever saw.

1355
02:22:37,992 --> 02:22:40,828
Lit up like
a floating birthday cake.

1356
02:22:42,229 --> 02:22:44,765
That's just what my husband
once said to me.

1357
02:22:44,832 --> 02:22:46,367
On this very spot.

1358
02:22:47,868 --> 02:22:49,937
Where is your husband now?

1359
02:22:50,004 --> 02:22:53,841
l wish l knew.
What brings you here?

1360
02:22:53,874 --> 02:22:56,744
l met my wife at this place.

1361
02:22:56,777 --> 02:22:59,046
lt's where l met my husband.

1362
02:22:59,079 --> 02:23:00,547
Small world.

1363
02:23:54,702 --> 02:23:55,669
Hello?

1364
02:24:43,050 --> 02:24:44,918
What are you doing here?

1365
02:24:44,952 --> 02:24:46,553
l've been following you.

1366
02:24:50,524 --> 02:24:52,192
Hold it right there!

1367
02:24:54,294 --> 02:24:55,262
Johnny?

1368
02:24:58,399 --> 02:24:59,700
lt's been so damn long,

1369
02:24:59,733 --> 02:25:01,835
l thought you'd forgotten
your Uncle Karl.

1370
02:25:03,070 --> 02:25:04,505
You son of a gun!

1371
02:25:07,908 --> 02:25:09,076
Uncle Karl...

1372
02:25:12,212 --> 02:25:13,180
Wait.

1373
02:25:16,083 --> 02:25:18,185
-ls that me?
-Yeah.

1374
02:25:26,493 --> 02:25:28,262
Shell Beach is where
l grew up?

1375
02:25:28,295 --> 02:25:30,898
That's what l said.
Shell Beach.

1376
02:25:30,964 --> 02:25:33,400
-Your home town.
-l need to get there.

1377
02:25:33,434 --> 02:25:34,468
How do l get there?

1378
02:25:35,903 --> 02:25:38,806
l don't know.
l haven't been there in years.

1379
02:25:38,839 --> 02:25:41,709
You must remember.
You must have some idea.

1380
02:25:43,677 --> 02:25:44,945
Sorry, Johnny.

1381
02:25:46,347 --> 02:25:48,882
The old cracker barrel
ain't what it used to be.

1382
02:25:52,720 --> 02:25:56,156
-lt was so bright there.
-Brighter times, l guess.

1383
02:25:57,925 --> 02:26:01,228
You were always scribbling
in that damn book.

1384
02:26:01,261 --> 02:26:03,230
That's me and your Pa.

1385
02:26:03,263 --> 02:26:05,599
What a couple of
handsome fools.

1386
02:26:05,632 --> 02:26:07,134
What happened to my parents?

1387
02:26:09,703 --> 02:26:10,838
Where are they now?

1388
02:26:12,106 --> 02:26:13,907
They're dead, Johnny.

1389
02:26:13,941 --> 02:26:16,710
They died when the house
burned down.

1390
02:26:16,744 --> 02:26:18,312
l looked after you.

1391
02:26:19,246 --> 02:26:21,048
You don't remember that,
really?

1392
02:26:23,851 --> 02:26:26,353
What's that? What is that?

1393
02:26:32,192 --> 02:26:34,061
lt's a scar.

1394
02:26:34,094 --> 02:26:36,430
You burned your arm pretty bad
in the fire.

1395
02:26:42,002 --> 02:26:43,537
What does it mean?

1396
02:26:43,604 --> 02:26:45,572
lt means these are all lies!

1397
02:26:49,677 --> 02:26:52,012
My husband told me
he'd been here.

1398
02:26:52,046 --> 02:26:54,848
He told me he wanted
to test himself.

1399
02:26:54,882 --> 02:26:57,184
See if he was...

1400
02:26:57,217 --> 02:26:59,553
capable of...

1401
02:27:08,429 --> 02:27:10,264
l wanted to talk to her.

1402
02:27:10,297 --> 02:27:12,266
l thought she could
help me find him.

1403
02:27:14,001 --> 02:27:15,970
l'm going to call the station.

1404
02:27:32,152 --> 02:27:33,354
lt's beautiful.

1405
02:27:36,056 --> 02:27:38,892
lt was a gift from my mother.

1406
02:27:38,926 --> 02:27:40,461
She died recently.

1407
02:27:41,862 --> 02:27:44,164
l keep it with me
to remind me of her.

1408
02:27:46,266 --> 02:27:47,301
l'm sorry.

1409
02:27:51,005 --> 02:27:53,107
lt's a funny thing, though.

1410
02:27:53,173 --> 02:27:55,609
l can't remember
when she gave it to me.

1411
02:27:58,078 --> 02:28:00,514
How do you think l could
forget a thing like that?

1412
02:28:01,982 --> 02:28:04,451
What's happening, lnspector?

1413
02:28:04,485 --> 02:28:06,320
l'm not sure l know anymore.

1414
02:28:10,290 --> 02:28:12,059
l left your old room
like it was.

1415
02:28:13,093 --> 02:28:15,362
You can sleep here tonight.

1416
02:28:15,396 --> 02:28:17,464
Glad to have you back, Johnny.

1417
02:28:17,531 --> 02:28:20,301
-Even if it is for just a night.
-Karl.

1418
02:28:21,435 --> 02:28:24,071
-ls that the right time?
-Why, sure.

1419
02:28:24,138 --> 02:28:26,573
That clock's kept perfect time
since l bought it.

1420
02:28:26,607 --> 02:28:27,941
A.M. or P.M.?

1421
02:28:29,610 --> 02:28:32,012
-What do you think?
-l don't understand.

1422
02:28:32,046 --> 02:28:34,815
How can it be night already?
What happened to the day?

1423
02:28:34,848 --> 02:28:37,351
You're tired.
Anything's possible.

1424
02:28:39,053 --> 02:28:40,020
Get some sleep.

1425
02:28:40,054 --> 02:28:42,523
We'll straighten all this out
tomorrow.

1426
02:29:14,655 --> 02:29:15,889
Come on...

1427
02:29:36,310 --> 02:29:39,279
He's here.
He's acting peculiar.

1428
02:29:39,346 --> 02:29:41,715
l know. He's not himself.

1429
02:29:41,749 --> 02:29:43,784
Keep him there,
and l'll be right over.

1430
02:29:43,851 --> 02:29:46,086
-l'll try.
-Thanks. Bye.

1431
02:29:49,657 --> 02:29:53,027
l can't promise anything.
We'll play it as it comes.

1432
02:29:53,761 --> 02:29:56,597
We just wanted to help.

1433
02:30:03,337 --> 02:30:06,940
Karl. Uncle Karl.

1434
02:30:07,007 --> 02:30:10,444
lf you're in trouble,
maybe we can do something.

1435
02:30:11,912 --> 02:30:14,415
Haven't seen you in so long.

1436
02:31:28,989 --> 02:31:33,627
Mr. Murdoch, you've been
the cause of much distress.

1437
02:31:38,499 --> 02:31:40,901
-Start talking.
-There's no need for this.

1438
02:31:40,934 --> 02:31:44,471
There's no escape.
The city's ours. We made it.

1439
02:31:44,538 --> 02:31:45,906
What are you talking about?

1440
02:31:45,939 --> 02:31:49,009
We fashioned this city
on stolen memories.

1441
02:31:49,076 --> 02:31:52,780
Different eras, different pasts,
all rolled into one.

1442
02:31:52,846 --> 02:31:56,884
Each night we revise it,
refine it, in order to learn.

1443
02:31:56,950 --> 02:31:59,953
-Learn what?
-About you.

1444
02:32:00,020 --> 02:32:04,425
You and your fellow inhabitants.
What makes you human.

1445
02:32:04,458 --> 02:32:07,928
-Why?
-We need to be like you.

1446
02:32:08,729 --> 02:32:10,864
l understand you now.

1447
02:32:10,931 --> 02:32:14,501
l remember that which you do
not, what you've been missing.

1448
02:32:14,568 --> 02:32:20,074
The ocean, yes? Running along
the waves as a child.

1449
02:32:20,140 --> 02:32:24,645
Meeting Emma at the river,
that first kiss that followed.

1450
02:32:25,646 --> 02:32:28,749
-What are you?
-You've seen what we are.

1451
02:32:28,816 --> 02:32:31,385
We use your dead as vessels.

1452
02:34:41,081 --> 02:34:42,049
Get in!

1453
02:34:57,531 --> 02:35:01,468
-What about her? Ring a bell?
-She was alive when l left her.

1454
02:35:01,502 --> 02:35:04,538
-What about this?
-This is nothing.

1455
02:35:04,605 --> 02:35:06,774
lt must mean something--
all those pictures.

1456
02:35:06,840 --> 02:35:07,808
What pictures?

1457
02:35:09,310 --> 02:35:12,179
-l don't understand this.
-Stop playing games with me.

1458
02:35:12,212 --> 02:35:14,682
-Stop telling me lies.
-l am not telling lies!

1459
02:35:14,715 --> 02:35:17,051
Help me out.
Make me understand.

1460
02:35:17,084 --> 02:35:22,022
l have this jigsaw puzzle in
my face, and it makes no sense.

1461
02:35:22,089 --> 02:35:25,459
You think it makes sense to me?
l'm as confused as you are.

1462
02:35:25,492 --> 02:35:29,396
Let me ask you a question.
Have you heard of Shell Beach?

1463
02:35:29,430 --> 02:35:31,565
-Sure.
-You know how to get there?

1464
02:35:31,632 --> 02:35:33,267
-Yeah.
-Tell me.

1465
02:35:33,867 --> 02:35:39,106
-Right. You just go to the...
-Where? Where do you go?

1466
02:35:39,139 --> 02:35:40,774
Give me a second, will you?

1467
02:35:42,743 --> 02:35:44,311
You can't remember, can you?

1468
02:35:45,746 --> 02:35:48,215
Thinking that's kind of odd?

1469
02:35:49,450 --> 02:35:51,518
Wait. l got a better one.

1470
02:35:51,585 --> 02:35:55,356
When was the last time you
did something during the day?

1471
02:35:55,956 --> 02:35:58,926
-What do you mean?
-l just mean during the day.

1472
02:36:00,160 --> 02:36:02,863
Daylight. When was the last
time you remember seeing it?

1473
02:36:02,930 --> 02:36:06,600
l'm not talking about a distant,
half-forgotten childhood memory.

1474
02:36:06,667 --> 02:36:09,436
l mean, like, yesterday.
Last week? When?

1475
02:36:10,404 --> 02:36:12,172
Do you have a single memory?

1476
02:36:13,941 --> 02:36:15,643
You don't, do you?

1477
02:36:15,709 --> 02:36:21,215
l don't think the sun
even exists in this place.

1478
02:36:21,281 --> 02:36:25,419
'Cause l've been up for hours
and hours, and night never ends.

1479
02:36:26,053 --> 02:36:28,355
-That's crazy.
-You're damn right it's crazy.

1480
02:36:28,389 --> 02:36:31,925
But listen to me, Bumstead.
lt's not just me.

1481
02:36:31,992 --> 02:36:34,928
lt's all of us. They're doing
something to all of us.

1482
02:36:34,962 --> 02:36:36,830
Shut up.
l've heard enough.

1483
02:36:36,864 --> 02:36:39,566
-Please listen--
-Shut up!

1484
02:36:50,044 --> 02:36:52,813
There has to be an explanation.

1485
02:37:00,187 --> 02:37:01,155
Explain this.

1486
02:37:23,010 --> 02:37:24,478
l'm so sorry.

1487
02:37:25,612 --> 02:37:28,549
l never meant to hurt you.
l don't know why l did.

1488
02:37:28,582 --> 02:37:30,351
l wish l could take it back.

1489
02:37:31,051 --> 02:37:33,354
You didn't do it.

1490
02:37:33,387 --> 02:37:35,089
This affair of yours,

1491
02:37:35,155 --> 02:37:38,158
whatever you think you've done,
you didn't do it.

1492
02:37:38,225 --> 02:37:39,426
l don't believe it happened.

1493
02:37:39,493 --> 02:37:43,297
-What do you mean?
-This will sound crazy.

1494
02:37:43,330 --> 02:37:46,433
What if we never knew
each other before now?

1495
02:37:46,500 --> 02:37:52,740
What if the first time we met
was last night in our apartment?

1496
02:37:52,773 --> 02:37:55,476
And everything you remember,

1497
02:37:55,542 --> 02:37:58,712
and everything l'm supposed to
remember never really happened.

1498
02:37:58,779 --> 02:38:01,248
Someone just wants us
to think it did.

1499
02:38:02,216 --> 02:38:03,717
But how can that be true?

1500
02:38:04,351 --> 02:38:07,321
l so vividly remember
meeting you.

1501
02:38:08,656 --> 02:38:11,025
l remember falling in love
with you.

1502
02:38:12,626 --> 02:38:15,562
-l remember losing you.
-Time's up.

1503
02:38:17,164 --> 02:38:21,935
No, wait, please.
Just one more minute.

1504
02:38:28,442 --> 02:38:29,943
l love you, John.

1505
02:38:33,380 --> 02:38:35,516
You can't fake something
like that.

1506
02:38:37,217 --> 02:38:38,686
No, you can't.

1507
02:39:07,982 --> 02:39:10,517
lnspector? Sir?

1508
02:39:11,952 --> 02:39:14,622
Detective Walenski
killed himself last night.

1509
02:39:17,024 --> 02:39:18,425
l thought you should know.

1510
02:39:21,061 --> 02:39:25,399
The chief wanted to see you.
Sir?

1511
02:39:32,306 --> 02:39:34,208
l knew you'd track
the killer down.

1512
02:39:49,690 --> 02:39:50,791
Shoelace.

1513
02:40:04,004 --> 02:40:07,141
-How can we help you, sir?
-You can sleep.

1514
02:40:10,611 --> 02:40:12,279
Sleep. Sleep.

1515
02:40:16,083 --> 02:40:17,184
Evening.

1516
02:40:30,130 --> 02:40:33,701
l wanted to be the first to
congratulate you about the case.

1517
02:40:36,303 --> 02:40:39,139
Take us to Murdoch.

1518
02:40:39,173 --> 02:40:40,140
Sleep.

1519
02:41:10,671 --> 02:41:12,239
l knew you'd come eventually.

1520
02:41:12,306 --> 02:41:14,775
lsn't it time
you gave me some answers?

1521
02:41:16,110 --> 02:41:18,846
Yes, of course.
Won't you please sit down?

1522
02:41:22,116 --> 02:41:24,018
l come here often.

1523
02:41:24,051 --> 02:41:26,587
lt's one of the few places
l'm allowed some peace.

1524
02:41:27,054 --> 02:41:30,090
You see, they have
an aversion to water.

1525
02:41:31,091 --> 02:41:33,060
One could almost call it
a phobia.

1526
02:41:33,560 --> 02:41:36,163
Who are they?
What do they want from me?

1527
02:41:36,230 --> 02:41:37,197
Right.

1528
02:41:37,931 --> 02:41:42,670
For now, let's say you're
the subject of their experiment.

1529
02:41:42,703 --> 02:41:44,138
We all are.

1530
02:41:45,806 --> 02:41:51,645
l'm sorry, but l have no time
to do this the right way.

1531
02:41:51,679 --> 02:41:55,683
Everything you need to know
is in this syringe.

1532
02:41:55,749 --> 02:41:59,286
l need you to inject yourself.
lt's the only way to understand.

1533
02:41:59,353 --> 02:42:02,156
-You're kidding, right?
-We're running out of time!

1534
02:42:02,189 --> 02:42:05,826
-You have to do this now.
-Give me the gun.

1535
02:42:05,893 --> 02:42:08,028
He's more disturbed
than we thought.

1536
02:42:08,095 --> 02:42:10,965
l may not be the judge
of personality you are,

1537
02:42:10,998 --> 02:42:13,968
but you're the one
who looks disturbed.

1538
02:42:14,001 --> 02:42:16,503
You don't know what
you're doing.

1539
02:42:17,738 --> 02:42:21,642
What exactly is in this, Doctor?

1540
02:42:23,344 --> 02:42:26,480
All the answers you've been
looking for, l swear to you.

1541
02:42:28,449 --> 02:42:34,154
Guess l'll hold on to it for
safekeeping, if you don't mind.

1542
02:42:34,221 --> 02:42:35,589
Let's go, Doctor.

1543
02:42:37,124 --> 02:42:40,260
Go? Where are we going?

1544
02:42:40,694 --> 02:42:42,429
Shell Beach.

1545
02:42:43,530 --> 02:42:47,001
That's where you wanted to go,
isn't it, the ocean?

1546
02:42:55,843 --> 02:42:59,280
Won't find anything there.
l've been there--

1547
02:42:59,313 --> 02:43:01,649
Then you can show us the way.

1548
02:43:01,682 --> 02:43:05,319
l won't. l refuse.
You can't make me go there.

1549
02:43:05,386 --> 02:43:07,821
Don't you understand?
They'll be waiting for us.

1550
02:43:17,131 --> 02:43:21,568
l don't understand.
There used to be a bridge here.

1551
02:43:26,974 --> 02:43:30,010
Try that again, and your friends
will find you in the canal.

1552
02:43:30,077 --> 02:43:31,879
Don't hurt me.
l'll tell you everything.

1553
02:43:31,912 --> 02:43:33,681
lt doesn't matter anymore
anyway.

1554
02:43:40,554 --> 02:43:41,522
What?

1555
02:43:44,925 --> 02:43:46,460
Who are you people?

1556
02:43:46,894 --> 02:43:49,697
Must go to the end
of the canal.

1557
02:43:50,998 --> 02:43:53,600
We will give you some more
pretty things soon...

1558
02:43:54,768 --> 02:43:57,104
-Anna.
-l'm not Anna.

1559
02:43:58,772 --> 02:44:00,808
You will be soon, yes.

1560
02:44:05,079 --> 02:44:07,948
l have another use
for her first.

1561
02:44:17,424 --> 02:44:19,326
l call them Strangers.

1562
02:44:19,893 --> 02:44:22,329
They abducted us
and brought us here.

1563
02:44:23,530 --> 02:44:27,968
This city, everyone in it...
is their experiment.

1564
02:44:28,002 --> 02:44:30,671
They mix and match our memories
as they see fit,

1565
02:44:30,738 --> 02:44:33,374
trying to divine
what makes us unique.

1566
02:44:33,907 --> 02:44:36,744
One day, a man might be
an inspector.

1567
02:44:36,777 --> 02:44:39,580
The next,
someone entirely different.

1568
02:44:39,947 --> 02:44:43,384
When they want to study
a murderer, for instance,

1569
02:44:43,417 --> 02:44:47,855
they simply imprint one of their
citizens with a new personality.

1570
02:44:47,921 --> 02:44:52,192
Arrange a family for him,
friends, an entire history...

1571
02:44:52,226 --> 02:44:54,094
even a lost wallet.

1572
02:44:54,128 --> 02:44:56,230
Then they observe the results.

1573
02:44:57,531 --> 02:45:01,669
Will a man, given the history of
a killer, continue in that vein?

1574
02:45:02,169 --> 02:45:05,739
Or are we, in fact, more than
the sum of our memories?

1575
02:45:05,806 --> 02:45:10,344
This business of you being
a killer was a sad coincidence.

1576
02:45:11,011 --> 02:45:13,580
You have had dozens of lives
before now.

1577
02:45:13,647 --> 02:45:15,082
You happened to wake up...

1578
02:45:15,115 --> 02:45:17,952
while l was imprinting you
with this one.

1579
02:45:17,985 --> 02:45:19,954
Why are they doing all this?

1580
02:45:20,020 --> 02:45:24,124
lt is our capacity for
individuality, our souls...

1581
02:45:24,191 --> 02:45:26,026
that makes us different
from them.

1582
02:45:26,060 --> 02:45:28,529
They think they'll find
the human soul...

1583
02:45:28,562 --> 02:45:31,231
if they understand
how our memories work.

1584
02:45:31,298 --> 02:45:35,736
They have collective memories.
They share one group mind.

1585
02:45:35,803 --> 02:45:40,674
They're dying. Their race is
on the brink of extinction.

1586
02:45:40,708 --> 02:45:43,711
-They think we can save them.
-Where do l fit in?

1587
02:45:43,777 --> 02:45:48,282
You're different. You resisted
my attempt to imprint you.

1588
02:45:53,220 --> 02:45:56,657
Somehow, you have developed
their ability to Tune.

1589
02:45:56,724 --> 02:45:59,994
That is how they change things,
how they built this city.

1590
02:46:00,027 --> 02:46:02,930
They have machines buried
beneath the surface...

1591
02:46:02,963 --> 02:46:06,467
that allow them to focus
their telepathic energies.

1592
02:46:07,234 --> 02:46:09,837
They control everything here,
even the sun.

1593
02:46:09,903 --> 02:46:13,073
That's why it's always dark.
They can't stand the light.

1594
02:46:13,140 --> 02:46:14,575
Why do they need you?

1595
02:46:14,608 --> 02:46:16,577
When they first brought us here,

1596
02:46:16,610 --> 02:46:20,914
they extracted what was in us
and stored the information,

1597
02:46:20,948 --> 02:46:22,883
remixed it like paint...

1598
02:46:22,916 --> 02:46:25,419
and gave us back
new memories of their choosing.

1599
02:46:25,486 --> 02:46:29,089
But they still needed an artist
to help them.

1600
02:46:30,858 --> 02:46:35,796
l understood the human mind
better than they ever could,

1601
02:46:35,863 --> 02:46:39,433
so they allowed me to keep
my skills as a scientist...

1602
02:46:39,500 --> 02:46:40,934
because they needed them.

1603
02:46:40,968 --> 02:46:43,404
They made me delete
everything else.

1604
02:46:51,979 --> 02:46:56,450
Can you imagine what it's like
to erase your own past?

1605
02:46:56,517 --> 02:46:59,720
What about my past?
What about my childhood?

1606
02:47:00,654 --> 02:47:02,690
Shell Beach. Uncle Karl.

1607
02:47:03,924 --> 02:47:07,995
What about this?
This was blank when l found it.

1608
02:47:08,062 --> 02:47:11,932
You still don't understand.
You were never a boy.

1609
02:47:11,966 --> 02:47:13,267
Not in this place.

1610
02:47:13,300 --> 02:47:16,203
Your history is an illusion,
a fabrication,

1611
02:47:16,236 --> 02:47:18,072
as it is with all of us.

1612
02:47:18,105 --> 02:47:20,608
You made those drawings happen
with your gift.

1613
02:47:20,674 --> 02:47:22,142
You say they brought us here.

1614
02:47:24,545 --> 02:47:25,512
From where?

1615
02:47:29,416 --> 02:47:32,553
l'm sorry. l don't remember.

1616
02:47:33,420 --> 02:47:37,591
None of us remember that...
what we once were...

1617
02:47:37,658 --> 02:47:41,195
what we might have been...
somewhere else.

1618
02:47:59,013 --> 02:48:02,783
l've taken you this far.
You don't need me anymore.

1619
02:48:02,816 --> 02:48:03,784
Let's go.

1620
02:48:49,196 --> 02:48:51,432
There is no ocean, John.

1621
02:48:52,733 --> 02:48:54,868
There's nothing beyond the city.

1622
02:48:56,503 --> 02:48:58,973
The only place home exists...

1623
02:49:01,208 --> 02:49:02,776
is in your head.

1624
02:49:14,221 --> 02:49:15,189
Stop!

1625
02:49:28,335 --> 02:49:29,303
Please!

1626
02:49:50,190 --> 02:49:52,293
Now you know the truth.

1627
02:50:51,852 --> 02:50:54,521
You'll allow yourself
to surrender...

1628
02:50:54,588 --> 02:50:56,890
or it will result in
this one's death.

1629
02:50:56,924 --> 02:50:58,092
What do l care?

1630
02:50:58,559 --> 02:51:00,628
She's not my real wife.
She's nothing to me.

1631
02:51:00,694 --> 02:51:05,332
But you do still care,
don't you, Mr. Murdoch?

1632
02:51:05,399 --> 02:51:09,637
l have become the monster
you were intended to be.

1633
02:51:11,639 --> 02:51:15,142
Shall l end her life now,
as you would have?

1634
02:51:18,712 --> 02:51:24,018
-Don't hurt her, please.
-Then surrender.

1635
02:51:26,220 --> 02:51:27,187
Sleep.

1636
02:51:29,356 --> 02:51:30,324
Now.

1637
02:51:49,643 --> 02:51:50,611
Sleep.

1638
02:51:59,687 --> 02:52:01,088
Kill him.

1639
02:52:01,121 --> 02:52:02,089
Kill him !

1640
02:52:12,666 --> 02:52:16,103
He is powerful, yes, dangerous.

1641
02:52:16,170 --> 02:52:19,506
But he can also lead us
to what we seek...

1642
02:52:19,540 --> 02:52:22,676
what the doctor calls the soul.

1643
02:52:22,743 --> 02:52:26,680
lt is time for our experiment
to move into a final phase.

1644
02:52:26,747 --> 02:52:29,516
We no longer need
the other subjects.

1645
02:52:29,583 --> 02:52:32,953
The time for study is over.

1646
02:52:32,987 --> 02:52:37,324
lt is time to be one
with John Murdoch.

1647
02:52:44,131 --> 02:52:47,501
lt is time, Doctor. lmprint.

1648
02:52:50,137 --> 02:52:52,306
Shut it down!

1649
02:52:53,240 --> 02:52:55,643
Shut it down forever.

1650
02:53:10,291 --> 02:53:11,358
What are you doing?

1651
02:53:12,293 --> 02:53:16,964
They want to imprint you with
their own collective memories.

1652
02:53:18,098 --> 02:53:20,267
They want to make you
one of them...

1653
02:53:20,334 --> 02:53:22,503
so they can share your soul.

1654
02:53:22,569 --> 02:53:24,905
But l've got other plans.

1655
02:53:28,275 --> 02:53:31,145
lmprint, Doctor.
No more disobedience.

1656
02:53:31,178 --> 02:53:35,816
l'm sorry. The pain will
only last a moment.

1657
02:53:46,961 --> 02:53:48,629
Remember, John.

1658
02:53:49,663 --> 02:53:51,699
You'll rise to greater heights
than that.

1659
02:53:51,765 --> 02:53:54,234
One day when you're older,
you'll understand.

1660
02:53:55,536 --> 02:53:56,503
Remember.

1661
02:53:57,905 --> 02:54:00,741
That's it, John.
Practice makes perfect.

1662
02:54:00,774 --> 02:54:03,978
Now, remember what l told you.
Never talk to strangers.

1663
02:54:04,378 --> 02:54:05,746
John, remember.

1664
02:54:05,946 --> 02:54:08,682
You're probably wondering why l
keep appearing in your memories.

1665
02:54:08,749 --> 02:54:11,185
lt's because l have
inserted myself in them.

1666
02:54:11,218 --> 02:54:15,189
They were fabricated to
teach you about the Strangers.

1667
02:54:15,255 --> 02:54:18,325
Give you a lifetime of knowledge
in a single syringe.

1668
02:54:21,195 --> 02:54:25,833
You will survive, John. You'll
find strength within yourself.

1669
02:54:25,899 --> 02:54:27,434
And you will prevail.

1670
02:54:28,135 --> 02:54:29,236
Remember.

1671
02:54:29,970 --> 02:54:32,172
-Hi, Uncle Karl.
-Johnny!

1672
02:54:35,142 --> 02:54:39,246
Getting the hang of it, John.
Maybe one day l'll work for you.

1673
02:54:39,880 --> 02:54:43,484
Here's the machine the Strangers
use to amplify their thoughts,

1674
02:54:43,550 --> 02:54:45,286
the machine that changes
their world.

1675
02:54:45,352 --> 02:54:48,589
You must take control of it.
You must make the machine yours.

1676
02:54:48,656 --> 02:54:53,227
l know you can beat them,
but you must concentrate.

1677
02:54:55,262 --> 02:54:56,463
Something's wrong.

1678
02:55:05,272 --> 02:55:07,174
There is no time for romance.

1679
02:55:07,207 --> 02:55:09,276
The world can be
what you make it.

1680
02:55:10,311 --> 02:55:11,345
What have you done?

1681
02:55:12,446 --> 02:55:14,581
You have the power
to make anything happen...

1682
02:55:14,648 --> 02:55:16,583
but you must act now.

1683
03:00:00,868 --> 03:00:05,139
l knew you could do it, John.
You have their power now.

1684
03:00:05,205 --> 03:00:07,474
-You control their machines.
-Where's Emma?

1685
03:00:08,642 --> 03:00:13,080
She's not Emma anymore.
She has been reimprinted.

1686
03:00:13,113 --> 03:00:15,349
-So give her back her memories.
-l can't.

1687
03:00:15,416 --> 03:00:19,486
The facility where they stored
the memories has been destroyed.

1688
03:00:20,321 --> 03:00:21,288
l'm sorry.

1689
03:00:22,723 --> 03:00:24,692
What are you going to do now?

1690
03:00:27,695 --> 03:00:29,163
l'm gonna fix things.

1691
03:00:30,831 --> 03:00:34,134
You told me l had the power,
didn't you?

1692
03:00:35,069 --> 03:00:38,038
l can make these machines
do anything l want.

1693
03:00:39,073 --> 03:00:41,108
Make this world
anything l want it to be.

1694
03:00:42,376 --> 03:00:46,413
Just so long as l concentrate
hard enough.

1695
03:02:10,097 --> 03:02:11,298
Where are you going?

1696
03:02:14,802 --> 03:02:15,769
Shell Beach.

1697
03:02:57,177 --> 03:02:58,646
-What's the fare?
-A quarter.

1698
03:03:05,452 --> 03:03:07,154
-Please.
-Oh, no, sit.

1699
03:03:08,489 --> 03:03:09,456
Thank you.

1700
03:03:55,502 --> 03:03:57,438
Been waiting for you, yes?

1701
03:03:58,138 --> 03:04:02,409
-What are you doing?
-l'm just making a few changes.

1702
03:04:02,476 --> 03:04:07,414
-We're sure that's what we want?
-l'll take my chances.

1703
03:04:07,448 --> 03:04:13,254
l'm dying, John. Your imprint
is not agreeable with my kind.

1704
03:04:13,287 --> 03:04:15,456
But l wanted to know
what it was like.

1705
03:04:17,191 --> 03:04:18,792
How you feel.

1706
03:04:18,859 --> 03:04:21,528
You know how l was
supposed to feel.

1707
03:04:21,595 --> 03:04:25,666
That person isn't me.
Never was.

1708
03:04:25,733 --> 03:04:28,902
You wanted to know what it was
that makes us human.

1709
03:04:30,037 --> 03:04:33,774
Well, you're not going to
find it in here.

1710
03:04:35,442 --> 03:04:37,211
You went looking
in the wrong place.

1711
03:06:16,443 --> 03:06:18,212
lt's so beautiful here.

1712
03:06:23,717 --> 03:06:24,952
So bright.

1713
03:06:31,258 --> 03:06:33,294
Do you know if Shell Beach
is around here?

1714
03:06:34,061 --> 03:06:36,430
l think that's it over there.

1715
03:06:54,682 --> 03:06:56,650
l'm headed that way myself.

1716
03:06:58,652 --> 03:07:00,020
Would you like to join me?

1717
03:07:03,157 --> 03:07:04,124
Sure.

1718
03:07:09,597 --> 03:07:13,100
l'm Anna, by the way.
What's your name?
